helmet must be covered with a minimum thickness of 12 mm of padding which meets SFI Spec
45.1 or FIA 8857-2001.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Brake System must:
a. Act on all four wheels
b. Be operated by a single control
c. Be capable of locking all four wheels

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Brake System must have two independent hydraulic circuits
A leak or failure at any point in the Brake System must maintain effective brake power on
minimum two wheels

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each hydraulic circuit must have its own fluid reserve using separate reservoirs or an OEM
style reservoir

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A single brake acting on a limited slip differential may be used

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Unarmored plastic brake lines are prohibited

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Brake System must be protected with scatter shields from failure of the drive train (see
T.5.2) or from minor collisions.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
In side view any portion of the Brake System that is mounted on the sprung part of the vehicle
must not project below the lower surface of the chassis

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.1.10 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Fasteners in the Brake System are Critical Fasteners, see T.8.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Brake Pedal must be one of:
• Fabricated from steel or aluminum
• Machined from steel, aluminum or titanium

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Brake Pedal and associated components design must withstand a minimum force of 2000
N without any failure of the Brake System, pedal box, chassis mounting, or pedal adjustment
This is not a design criteria. The Brake Pedal and Brake System may be tested by pressing the
pedal with the maximum force that can be exerted by any official when seated normally

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Failure of non-loadbearing components in the Brake System or pedal box must not interfere
with Brake Pedal operation or Brake System function

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
(EV only) Additional requirements for Electric Vehicles:
a. The first 90% of the Brake Pedal travel may be used to regenerate energy without
actuating the hydraulic brake system.
b. The remaining Brake Pedal travel must directly actuate the hydraulic brake system.
Brake energy regeneration may stay active.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must have a Brake Over Travel Switch (BOTS). Brake pedal travel exceeding the
normal range will actuate the switch

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BOTS must be a mechanical single pole, single throw (commonly known as a two position)
switch (push-pull or flip type).

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Operation of the BOTS to the OFF position must Open the Shutdown Circuit IC.9.2.2 / EV.7.2.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Repeated operation of the switch must not reset or restore power

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.3.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The driver must not be able to reset the BOTS.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.3.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BOTS must be implemented with analog components, and not using programmable logic
controllers, engine control units, or similar functioning digital controllers.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must have a Brake Light that is clearly visible from the rear in very bright sunlight.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Brake Light must be:
a. Red in color on a Black background
b. Rectangular, triangular or near round shape with a minimum shining surface of 15 cm2
c. Mounted between the wheel centerline and driver’s shoulder level vertically and
approximately on vehicle centerline laterally.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: When LED lights are used without a diffuser, they must not be more than 20 mm apart.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.3.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: If a single line of LEDs is used, the minimum length is 150 mm.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Applicability
This section T.4 applies only for:
• IC vehicles using Electronic Throttle Control (ETC) IC.4
• EV vehicles

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor - APPS

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accelerator Pedal must actuate the APPS T.1.4.1
a. Two springs must be used to return the foot pedal to 0% Pedal Travel
b. Each spring must be capable of returning the pedal to 0% Pedal Travel with the other
disconnected. The springs in the APPS are not acceptable pedal return springs.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Two or more electrically separate sensors must be used as APPSs. A single OEM type APPS
with two completely separate sensors in a single housing is acceptable.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The APPS sensors must have different transfer functions which meet one of the two:
• Each sensor has different gradients and/or offsets to the other(s). The circuit must have
a pull-up or pull-down resistor to bring an open circuit input to 0% Pedal Travel
• An OEM pedal sensor with opposite slopes. Non OEM opposite slope sensor
configurations require prior approval.
The intent is that in a short circuit the APPSs will only agree at 0% Pedal Travel

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Implausibility is defined as a deviation of more than 10% Pedal Travel between the sensors or
other failure as defined in this Section T.4.2. Use of values larger than 10% Pedal Travel
require justification in the ETC Systems Form and may not be approved

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If an Implausibility occurs between the values of the APPSs and persists for more than 100
msec, the power to the (IC) Electronic Throttle / (EV) Motor(s) must be immediately stopped
completely.
(EV only) It is not necessary to Open the Shutdown Circuit, the motor controller(s) stopping
the power to the Motor(s) is sufficient.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If three sensors are used, then in the case of an APPS failure, any two sensors that agree
within 10% Pedal Travel may be used to define the (IC) throttle position / (EV) torque target
and the 3rd APPS may be ignored.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each APPS must be able to be checked during Technical Inspection by having one of the two:
• A separate detachable connector that enables a check of functions by unplugging it
• An inline switchable breakout box available that allows disconnection of each APPS
signal.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The APPS signals must be sent directly to a controller using an analogue signal or via a digital
data transmission bus such as CAN or FlexRay.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any failure of the APPS or APPS wiring must be detectable by the controller and must be
treated like an Implausibility, see T.4.2.4 above

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.10 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When an analogue signal is used, the APPS will be considered to have failed when they
achieve an open circuit or short circuit condition which generates a signal outside of the
normal operating range, for example <0.5 V or >4.5 V.
The circuitry used to evaluate the sensor must use pull down or pull up resistors to ensure
that open circuit signals result in a failure being detected.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.11 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When any kind of digital data transmission is used to transmit the APPS signal,
a. The ETC Systems Form must contain a detailed description of all the potential failure
modes that can occur, the strategy that is used to detect these failures and the tests that
have been conducted to prove that the detection strategy works.
b. The failures to be considered must include but are not limited to the failure of the APPS,
APPS signals being out of range, corruption of the message and loss of messages and the
associated time outs.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.2.12 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The current rules are written to only apply to the APPS (pedal), but the integrity of the torque
command signal is important in all stages.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must have a sensor or switch to measure brake pedal position or brake system
pressure

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BSE must be able to be checked during Technical Inspection by having one of:
• A separate detachable connector(s) for any BSE signal(s) to the main ECU without
affecting any other connections
• An inline switchable breakout box available that allows disconnection of each BSE
signal(s) to the main ECU without affecting any other connections

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BSE or switch signals must be sent directly to a controller using an analogue signal or via a
digital data transmission bus such as CAN or FlexRay
Any failure of the BSE or BSE wiring that persists more than 100 msec must be detectable by
the controller and treated like an implausibility and power to the (IC) electronic throttle / (EV)
Motor(s) must be immediately stopped completely.
(EV only) It is not necessary to completely deactivate the Tractive System, the motor
controller(s) stopping power to the motor(s) is sufficient.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When an analogue signal is used, the BSE sensors will be considered to have failed when they
achieve an open circuit or short circuit condition which generates a signal outside of the
normal operating range, for example <0.5 V or >4.5 V.
The circuitry used to evaluate the sensor must use pull down or pull up resistors to ensure
that open circuit signals result in a failure being detected.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.4.3.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When any kind of digital data transmission is used to transmit the BSE signal:
a. The ETC Systems Form must contain a detailed description of all the potential failure
modes that can occur, the strategy that is used to detect these failures and the tests that
have been conducted to prove that the detection strategy works.
b. The failures modes must include but are not limited to the failure of the sensor, sensor
signals being out of range, corruption of the message and loss of messages and the
associated time outs.
c. In all cases a sensor failure must immediately shutdown power to the motor(s).

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Transmission and Drive
Any transmission and drivetrain may be used.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Exposed high speed final drivetrain equipment such as Continuously Variable Transmissions
(CVTs), sprockets, gears, pulleys, torque converters, clutches, belt drives, clutch drives and
electric motors, must be fitted with scatter shields intended to contain drivetrain parts in case
of radial failure

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The final drivetrain shield must:
a. Be made with solid material (not perforated)
b. Cover the chain or belt from the drive sprocket to the driven sprocket/chain wheel/belt
or pulley
c. Start and end no higher than parallel to the lowest point of the chain wheel/belt/pulley:
d. Cover the bottom of the chain or belt or rotating component when fuel, brake lines
T.3.1.8, control, pressurized, electrical components are located below

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Body panels or other existing covers are acceptable when constructed per T.5.2.7 / T.5.2.8

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Frame Members or existing components that exceed the scatter shield material requirements
may be used as part of the shield.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Scatter shields may be composed of multiple pieces. Any gaps must be small (< 3 mm)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: If equipped, the engine drive sprocket cover may be used as part of the scatter shield system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Chain Drive - Scatter shields for chains must:
a. Be made of 2.66 mm (0.105 inch) minimum thickness steel (no alternatives are allowed)
b. Have a minimum width equal to three times the width of the chain
c. Be centered on the center line of the chain
d. Stay aligned with the chain under all conditions

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Non-metallic Belt Drive - Scatter shields for belts must:
a. Be made from 3.0 mm minimum thickness aluminum alloy 6061-T6
b. Have a minimum width that is equal to 1.7 times the width of the belt.
c. Be centered on the center line of the belt
d. Stay aligned with the belt under all conditions

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Attachment Fasteners - All fasteners attaching scatter shields and guards must be 6 mm or
1/4” minimum diameter Critical Fasteners, see T.8.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.2.10 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Finger Guards
a. Must cover any drivetrain parts that spin while the vehicle is stationary with the engine
running.
b. Must be made of material sufficient to resist finger forces.
c. Mesh or perforated material may be used but must prevent the passage of a 12 mm
diameter object through the guard.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The rotating part of the Motor(s) EV.4.1 must be contained in a structural casing.
The motor casing may be the original motor casing, a team built motor casing or the original
casing with additional material added to achieve the minimum required thickness.
• Minimum thickness for aluminum alloy 6061-T6: 3.0 mm
If lower grade aluminum alloy is used, then the material must be thicker to provide an
equivalent strength.
• Minimum thickness for steel: 2.0 mm

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A Scatter Shield must be included around the Motor(s) when one or both:
• The motor casing rotates around the stator
• The motor case is perforated

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Motor Scatter Shield must be:
• Made from aluminum alloy 6061-T6 or steel
• Minimum thickness: 1.0 mm

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Water cooled engines must use only plain water with no additives of any kind

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Liquid coolant for electric motors, Accumulators or HV electronics must be one of:
• plain water with no additives
• oil

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: (EV only) Liquid coolant must not directly touch the cells in the Accumulator

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Any cooling or lubrication system must be sealed to prevent leakage

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must be capable of being tilted to a 45° angle without leaking fluid of any type.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Flammable liquid and vapors or other leaks must not collect or contact the driver

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Two holes of minimum diameter 25 mm each must be provided in the structure or belly pan at
the locations:
a. The lowest point of the chassis
b. Rearward of the driver position, forward of a fuel tank or other liquid source
c. If the lowest point of the chassis obeys T.5.5.4.b, then only one set of holes T.5.5.4.a is
necessary

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.5.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Absorbent material and open collection devices (regardless of material) are prohibited in
compartments containing engine, drivetrain, exhaust and fuel systems below the highest
point on the exhaust system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must have separate containers (catch cans) to retain fluids from any vents from
the powertrain systems.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Catch cans must be:
a. Capable of containing boiling water without deformation
b. Located rearwards of the Firewall below the driver’s shoulder level
c. Positively retained, using no tie wraps or tape

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.6.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Catch cans for the engine coolant system and engine lubrication system must have a minimum
capacity of 10% of the fluid being contained or 0.9 liter, whichever is higher

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.6.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Catch cans for any vent on other systems containing liquid lubricant or coolant, including a
differential, gearbox, or electric motor, must have a minimum capacity of 10% of the fluid
being contained or 0.5 liter, whichever is higher

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.5.6.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any catch can on the cooling system must vent through a hose with a minimum internal
diameter of 3 mm down to the bottom levels of the Chassis.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Compressed Gas Cylinders and Lines
Any system on the vehicle that uses a compressed gas as an actuating medium must meet the
following:

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Working Gas - The working gas must be non flammable

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cylinder Certification - The gas cylinder/tank must be commercially manufactured, designed
and built for the pressure being used, certified by an accredited testing laboratory in the
country of its origin, and labeled or stamped appropriately.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Pressure Regulation - The pressure regulator must be mounted directly onto the gas
cylinder/tank

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Lines and Fittings - The gas lines and fittings must be appropriate for the maximum possible
operating pressure of the system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Insulation - The gas cylinder/tank must be insulated from any heat sources

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cylinder Material – gas cylinders/tanks in a position 150 mm or less from an exhaust system
must meet one of the two:
• Made from metal
• Meet the thermal protection requirements of T.1.6.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cylinder Location - The gas cylinder/tank and the pressure regulator must be:
a. Securely mounted inside the Chassis
b. Located outside of the Cockpit
c. In a position below the height of the Shoulder Belt Mount T.2.6
d. Aligned so the axis of the gas cylinder/tank does not point at the driver

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Protection – The gas cylinder/tank and lines must be protected from rollover, collision from
any direction, or damage resulting from the failure of rotating equipment

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.1.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The driver must be protected from failure of the cylinder/tank and regulator

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
High Pressure Hydraulic Pumps and Lines
This section T.6.2 does not apply to Brake lines or hydraulic clutch lines

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The driver and anyone standing outside the vehicle must be shielded from any hydraulic
pumps and lines with line pressures of 2100 kPa or higher.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.6.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The shields must be steel or aluminum with a minimum thickness of 1 mm.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Aerodynamic Device
A part on the vehicle which guides airflow for purposes including generation of downforce
and/or change of drag.
Examples include but are not limited to: wings, undertray, splitter, endplates, vanes

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
No power device may be used to move or remove air from under the vehicle. Power ground
effects are strictly prohibited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Aerodynamic Devices must meet:
a. The mounting system provides sufficient rigidity in the static condition
b. The Aerodynamic Devices do not oscillate or move excessively when the vehicle is
moving. Refer to IN.8.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All forward facing edges that could contact a pedestrian (wings, end plates, and undertrays)
must have a minimum radius of 5 mm for all horizontal edges and 3 mm for vertical edges.
This may be the radius of the edges themselves, or additional permanently attached pieces
designed to meet this requirement.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Other edges that a person may touch must not be sharp

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Conventionally designed Bodywork or a nose cone is not considered an Aerodynamic Device

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Bodywork, a nose cone, or another component mounted to the vehicle is an Aerodynamic
Device if is designed to, or may possibly, produce force due to aerodynamic effects

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Bodywork must not contain openings into the cockpit from the front of the vehicle back to the
Main Hoop or Firewall. The cockpit opening and minimal openings around the front
suspension components are allowed.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All forward facing edges on the Bodywork that could contact people, including the nose, must
have forward facing radii minimum 38 mm. This minimum radius must extend 45° or more
relative to the forward direction, along the top, sides and bottom of all affected edges.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Aerodynamic Device limitations are measured:
a. With the wheels pointing in the straight ahead position
b. Without a driver in the vehicle
The intent is to standardize the measurement, see GR.6.4.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Head Restraint Plane
A transverse vertical plane through the rearmost portion of the front face of the driver head
restraint support, excluding any padding, set (if adjustable) in its fully rearward position

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Rear Aerodynamic Zone
The volume that is:
• Rearward of the Head Restraint Plane
• Inboard of two vertical planes parallel to the centerline of the chassis touching the inside
of the rear tires at the height of the hub centerline

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Location
Any part of any Aerodynamic Device or Bodywork must meet V.1.1 and V.1.4.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Length
In plan view, any part of any Aerodynamic Device must be:
a. No more than 700 mm forward of the fronts of the front tires
b. No more than 250 mm rearward of the rear of the rear tires

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Width
In plan view, any part of any Aerodynamic Device must be:

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When forward of the centerline of the front wheel axles:
Inboard of two vertical planes parallel to the centerline of the chassis touching the outside of
the front tires at the height of the hubs.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When between the centerlines of the front and rear wheel axles:
Inboard of a line drawn connecting the outer surfaces of the front and rear tires at the height
of the wheel centers

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.6.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When rearward of the centerline of the rear wheel axles:
In the Rear Aerodynamic Zone

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any part of any Aerodynamic Device that is located:
a. In the Rear Aerodynamic Zone must be no higher than 1200 mm above the ground
b. Outside of the Rear Aerodynamic Zone must be no higher than 500 mm above the
ground
c. Forward of the centerline of the front wheel axles and outboard of two vertical planes
parallel to the centerline of the chassis touching the inside of the front tires at the height
of the hubs must be no higher than 250 mm above the ground

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.7.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Bodywork height is not restricted when the Bodywork is located:
• Between the transverse vertical planes positioned at the front and rear axle centerlines
• Inside two vertical fore and aft planes 400 mm outboard from the centerline on each
side of the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Critical Fasteners
A fastener (bolt, screw, pin, etc) used in a location specified in the applicable rule

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Critical Fastener must meet, at minimum, one of the following:
a. SAE Grade 5
b. Metric Class 8.8
c. AN/MS Specifications
d. Equivalent to or better than above, as approved by a Rules Question or at Technical
Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All threaded Critical Fasteners must be one of the following:
• Hex head
• Hexagonal recessed drive (Socket Head Cap Screws or Allen screws/bolts)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Critical Fasteners must be secured from unintentional loosening with Positive Locking
Mechanisms see T.8.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A minimum of two full threads must project from any lock nut.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Some Critical Fastener applications have additional requirements that are provided in the
applicable section.

woleb

005
mm
005

mm

mm

mm
0021
mm

evoba mm
005
woleb

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Positive Locking Mechanisms are defined as those which:
a. Technical Inspectors / team members can see that the device/system is in place (visible).
b. Do not rely on the clamping force to apply the locking or anti vibration feature.
Meaning If the fastener begins to loosen, the locking device still prevents the fastener coming
completely loose

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Examples of acceptable Positive Locking Mechanisms include, but are not limited to:
a. Correctly installed safety wiring
b. Cotter pins
c. Nylon lock nuts (where temperature does not exceed 80°C)
d. Prevailing torque lock nuts
Lock washers, bolts with nylon patches and thread locking compounds (Loctite®), DO NOT
meet the positive locking requirement.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.8.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Requirements for All Fasteners
Adjustable tie rod ends must be constrained with a jam nut to prevent loosening.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
High Voltage – HV
Any voltage more than 60 V DC or 25 V AC RMS

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Low Voltage - LV
Any voltage less than and including 60 V DC or 25 V AC RMS

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Normally Open
A type of electrical relay or contactor that allows current flow only in the energized state

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Low Voltage Batteries and onboard power supplies must be securely mounted inside the
Chassis below the height of the Shoulder Belt Mount T.2.6

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Low Voltage batteries must have Overcurrent Protection that trips at or below the
maximum specified discharge current of the cells

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The hot (ungrounded) terminal must be insulated.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any wet cell battery located in the driver compartment must be enclosed in a nonconductive
marine type container or equivalent.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Batteries or battery packs based on lithium chemistry must meet one of the two:
a. Have a rigid, sturdy casing made from Nonflammable Material
b. A commercially available battery designed as an OEM style replacement

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All batteries using chemistries other than lead acid must be presented at Technical Inspection
with markings identifying it for comparison to a datasheet or other documentation proving
the pack and supporting electronics meet all rules requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Master Switches
Each Master Switch ( IC.9.3 / EV.7.9 ) must meet the following:

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Location
a. On the driver’s right hand side of the vehicle
b. In proximity to the Main Hoop
c. At the driver's shoulder height
d. Able to be easily actuated from outside the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Characteristics
a. Be of the rotary mechanical type
b. Be rigidly mounted to the vehicle and must not be removed during maintenance
c. Mounted where the rotary axis of the key is near horizontal and across the vehicle
d. The ON position must be in the horizontal position and must be marked accordingly
e. The OFF position must be clearly marked
f. (EV Only) Operated with a red removable key that must only be removable in the
electrically open position

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inertia Switch Requirement
• (EV) Must have an Inertia Switch
• (IC) Should have an Inertia Switch

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Inertia Switch must be:
a. A Sensata Resettable Crash Sensor or equivalent
b. Mechanically and rigidly attached to the vehicle
c. Removable to test functionality

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule T.9.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inertia Switch operation:
a. Must trigger due to a longitudinal impact load which decelerates the vehicle at between
8 g and 11 g depending on the duration of the deceleration (refer to spec sheet of the
Sensata device)
b. Must Open the Shutdown Circuit IC.9.2.2 / EV.7.2.2 if triggered
c. Must latch until manually reset
d. May be reset by the driver from inside the driver's cell

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.1.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The assigned vehicle number must appear on the vehicle as follows:
a. Locations: in three places, on the front of the chassis and both sides
b. Height: 150 mm minimum
c. Font: Block numbers (sans serif characters without italic, outline, shadow, or cursive
numbers)
d. Stroke Width and Spacing between numbers: 18 mm minimum
e. Color: White numbers on a black background OR black numbers on a white background
f. Background: round, oval, square or rectangular
g. Spacing: 25 mm minimum between the edge of the numbers and the edge of the
background
h. The numbers must not be obscured by parts of the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.1.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Additional letters or numerals must not show before or after the vehicle number

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
School Name
Each vehicle must clearly display the school name.
a. Abbreviations are allowed if unique and generally recognized
b. The name must be in Roman characters minimum 50 mm high on both sides of the
vehicle.
c. The characters must be placed on a high contrast background in an easily visible location.
d. The school name may also appear in non Roman characters, but the Roman character
version must be uppermost on the sides.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
SAE Logo
The SAE International Logo must be displayed on the front and/or both sides of the vehicle in
a prominent location.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inspection Sticker
The vehicle must have space for the Inspection Sticker(s) IN.13.2 that is:
• A clear and unobstructed area, minimum 25 cm wide x 20 cm high
• Located on the upper front surface of the nose along the vehicle centerline

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.1.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each vehicle must have a functional, properly mounted transponder and/or RFID tag of the
specified type(s)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.1.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Refer to the Rules FAQ on the FSAE Online website for transponder and RFID tag information
and mounting details

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A Jacking Point must be provided at the rear of the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Jacking Point must be:
a. Capable of supporting the vehicle weight and of engaging the organizer Quick Jacks
b. Visible to a person standing 1 m behind the vehicle
c. Color: Orange
d. Oriented laterally and perpendicular to the centerline of the vehicle
e. Made from round, 25 - 30 mm OD aluminum or steel tube
f. Exposed around the lower 180° of its circumference over a minimum length of 280 mm
g. Access from the rear of the tube must be unobstructed for 300 mm or more of its length
h. The height of the tube must allow 75 mm minimum clearance from the bottom of the
tube to the ground
i. When the vehicle is raised to where the bottom of the tube is 200 mm above ground, the
wheels do not touch the ground when they are in full rebound

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Push Bar
Each vehicle must have a removable device which attaches to the rear of the vehicle that:
a. Allows two people, standing erect behind the vehicle, to push the vehicle around the
competition site
b. Is capable of slowing and stopping the forward motion of the vehicle and pulling it
rearwards

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each team must have two or more fire extinguishers.
a. One extinguisher must readily be available in the team’s paddock area
b. One extinguisher must accompany the vehicle when moved using the push bar
A commercially available on board fire system may be used instead of the fire
extinguisher that accompanies the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Hand held fire extinguishers must NOT be mounted on or in the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each fire extinguisher must meet the following:
a. Capacity: 0.9 kg (2 lbs)
b. Working Medium: Dry chemical/dry powder. Aqueous Film Forming Foam (AFFF) and
Halon extinguishers and systems are prohibited.
c. Equipped with a manufacturer installed pressure/charge gauge.
d. Minimum acceptable ratings:
• USA, Canada & Brazil: 10BC or 1A 10BC
• Europe: 34B or 5A 34B
• Australia: 20BE or 1A 10BE
e. Extinguishers of larger capacity (higher numerical ratings) are acceptable.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Electrical Equipment (EV Only)
The following items must accompany the vehicle at all times:
• Two pairs of High Voltage insulating gloves
• A multimeter

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The mounts for video/photographic cameras must be of a safe and secure design.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All camera installations must be approved at Technical Inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Helmet mounted cameras and helmet camera mounts are prohibited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The body of a camera or recording unit that weighs more than 0.25 kg must be secured at a
minimum of two points on different sides of the camera body.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.2.5.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If a tether is used to restrain the camera, the tether length must be limited to prevent contact
with the driver.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Driver Equipment:
a. Must be in good condition with no tears, rips, open seams, areas of significant wear,
abrasions or stains which might compromise performance.
b. Must fit properly
c. May be inspected at any time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Flame Resistant Material
For this section some, but not all, of the approved materials are: Carbon X, Indura, Nomex,
Polybenzimidazole (common name PBI) and Proban.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Synthetic Material – Prohibited
Shirts, socks or other undergarments (not to be confused with flame resistant underwear)
made from nylon or any other synthetic material which could melt when exposed to high heat
are prohibited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Officials may impound any non approved Driver Equipment until the end of the competition.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The driver must wear a helmet which:
a. Is closed face with an integral, immovable chin guard
b. Contains an integrated visor/face shield supplied with the helmet
c. Meets an approved standard
d. Is properly labeled for that standard

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Acceptable helmet standards are listed below. Any additional approved standards are shown
on the Technical Inspection Form or the FAQ on the FSAE Online website.
a. Snell K2010, K2015, K2020, M2010, M2015, M2020, SA2010, SAH2010, SA2015, SA2020
b. SFI Specs 31.1/2010, 31.1/2015, 41.1/2010, 41.1/2015
c. FIA Standards FIA 8860-2004, FIA 8860-2010, FIA 8860-2018, FIA 8859-2015

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Driver Gear
The driver must wear the following:

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Driver Suit
A one piece suit, made from a minimum of two layers of Flame Resistant Material that covers
the body from the neck to the ankles and the wrists.
Each suit must meet one or more of the following standards and be labeled as such:
• SFI 3.2A/5 (or higher ex: /10, /15, /20)
• SFI 3.4/5 (or higher ex: /10, /15, /20)
• FIA Standard 1986
• FIA Standard 8856-2000
• FIA Standard 8856-2018

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Underclothing
All competitors should wear fire retardant underwear (long pants and long sleeve shirt) under
their approved Driver Suit.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Balaclava
A Balaclava (head sock) which covers the driver’s head, hair and neck, made from Flame
Resistant Material

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Socks
Socks made from Flame Resistant Material that cover the bare skin between the driver’s suit
and the Shoes.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Shoes
Shoes or boots made from Flame Resistant Material that meet an approved standard and
labeled as such:
• SFI Spec 3.3
• FIA Standard 8856-2000
• FIA Standard 8856-2018

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Gloves
Gloves made from Flame Resistant Material.
Gloves of all leather construction or fire retardant gloves constructed using leather palms with
no insulating Flame Resistant Material underneath are not acceptable.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule VE.3.3.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Arm Restraints
a. Arm restraints must be worn in a way that the driver can release them and exit the
vehicle unassisted regardless of the vehicle’s position.
b. Arm restraints must be commercially manufactured. Arm restraints certified to SFI Spec
3.3 and labeled as such meet this requirement.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.1.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The engine(s) used to power the vehicle must:
a. Be a piston engine(s) using a four stroke primary heat cycle
b. Have a total combined displacement less than or equal to 710 cc per cycle.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.1.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Hybrid powertrains, such as those using electric motors running off stored energy, are
prohibited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.1.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All waste/rejected heat from the primary heat cycle may be used. The method of conversion is
not limited to the four stroke cycle.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.1.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The engine may be modified within the restrictions of the rules.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Air Intake and Fuel System Location
All parts of the engine air system and fuel control, delivery and storage systems (including the
throttle or carburetor, and the complete air intake system, including the air cleaner and any
air boxes) must lie inside the Tire Surface Envelope F.1.14

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any portion of the air intake system that is less than 350 mm above the ground must be
shielded from side or rear impacts by structure built per F.6.4 / F.7.5 as applicable.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The intake manifold must be securely attached to the engine block or cylinder head with
brackets and mechanical fasteners.
• Hose clamps, plastic ties, or safety wires do not meet this requirement.
• The use of rubber bushings or hose is acceptable for creating and sealing air passages,
but is not a structural attachment.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Threaded fasteners used to secure and/or seal the intake manifold must have a Positive
Locking Mechanism, see T.8.3.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Intake systems with significant mass or cantilever from the cylinder head must be supported
to prevent stress to the intake system.
a. Supports to the engine must be rigid.
b. Supports to the Chassis must incorporate some isolation to allow for engine movement
and chassis flex.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All airflow to the engine(s) must pass through a single circular restrictor placed in the intake
system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The only allowed sequence of components are the following:
a. For naturally aspirated engines, the sequence must be: throttle body, restrictor, and
engine.
b. For turbocharged or supercharged engines, the sequence must be: restrictor,
compressor, throttle body, engine.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The maximum restrictor diameters at any time during the competition are:
a. Gasoline fueled vehicles 20.0 mm
b. E85 fueled vehicles 19.0 mm

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The restrictor must be located to facilitate measurement during Technical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The circular restricting cross section must NOT be movable or flexible in any way

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.4.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The restrictor must not be part of the movable portion of a barrel throttle body.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The intake air may be cooled with an intercooler (a charge air cooler).
a. It must be located downstream of the throttle body
b. Only ambient air may be used to remove heat from the intercooler system
c. Air to air and water to air intercoolers are permitted
d. The coolant of a water to air intercooler system must meet T.5.4.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If pop-off valves, recirculation valves, or heat exchangers (intercoolers) are used, they must be
positioned in the intake system as shown in IC.2.4.2.b

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Plenums must not be located anywhere upstream of the throttle body
For the purpose of definition, a plenum is any tank or volume that is a significant enlargement
of the normal intake runner system. Teams may submit their designs via a Rules Question for
review prior to competition if the legality of their proposed system is in doubt.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The maximum allowable area of the inner diameter of the intake runner system between the
restrictor and throttle body is 2825 mm2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Connections to Intake
Any crankcase or engine lubrication vent lines routed to the intake system must be connected
upstream of the intake system restrictor.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.3.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must have a carburetor or throttle body.
a. The carburetor or throttle body may be of any size or design.
b. Boosted applications must not use carburetors.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Throttle Actuation Method
The throttle may be actuated:
a. Mechanically by a cable or rod system IC.3.3
b. By Electronic Throttle Control IC.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.3.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The throttle cable or rod must:
a. Have smooth operation
b. Have no possibility of binding or sticking
c. Be minimum 50 mm from any exhaust system component and out of the exhaust stream
d. Be protected from being bent or kinked by the driver’s foot when it is operated by the
driver or when the driver enters or exits the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.3.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The throttle actuation system must use two or more return springs located at the throttle
body.
Throttle Position Sensors (TPS) are NOT acceptable as return springs

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.3.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Failure of any component of the throttle system must not prevent the throttle returning to
the closed position.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
ELECTRONIC THROTTLE CONTROL
This section IC.4 applies only when Electronic Throttle Control is used
An Electronic Throttle Control (ETC) system may be used. This is a device or system which
may change the engine throttle setting based on various inputs.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The electronic throttle must automatically close (return to idle) when power is removed.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The electronic throttle must use minimum two sources of energy capable of returning the
throttle to the idle position.
a. One of the sources may be the device (such as a DC motor) that normally actuates the
throttle
b. The other device(s) must be a throttle return spring that can return the throttle to the
idle position if loss of actuator power occurs.
c. Springs in the TPS are not acceptable throttle return springs

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
