The ETC system may blip the throttle during downshifts when proven that unintended
acceleration can be avoided. The functional analysis must be documented in the ETC Systems
Form

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
An ETC system that is commercially available, but does not comply with the regulations, may
be used, if approved prior to the event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
To obtain approval, submit a Rules Question which includes:
• Which ETC system the team is seeking approval to use.
• The specific ETC rule(s) that the commercial system deviates from.
• Sufficient technical details of these deviations to determine the acceptability of the
commercial system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The ETC Notice of Intent:
• Must be submitted to inform the organizer of the intent to run ETC
• May be used to screen which teams are allowed to use ETC

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The ETC Systems Form must be submitted in order to use ETC

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Submit the ETC Notice of Intent and ETC Systems Form as given in section DR - Document
Requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Late or non submission will prevent use of ETC, see DR.3.4.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The TPS must measure the position of the throttle or the throttle actuator.
Throttle position is defined as percent of travel from fully closed to wide open where 0% is
fully closed and 100% is fully open.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Two or more separate sensors must be used as TPSs. The TPSs may share the same supply and
reference lines only if effects of supply and/or reference line voltage offsets can be detected.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Implausibility is defined as a deviation of more than 10% throttle position between the
sensors or other failure as defined in Section IC.4. Use of values larger than 10% may be
considered on a case by case basis and require justification in the ETC Systems Form

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If an Implausibility occurs between the values of the two TPSs and persists for more than 100
msec, the power to the electronic throttle must be immediately shut down.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If three sensors are used, then in the case of a TPS failure, any two TPSs that agree within 10%
throttle position may be used to define the throttle position target and the 3rd TPS may be
ignored.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each TPS must be able to be checked during Technical Inspection by having one of:
a. A separate detachable connector(s) for any TPS signal(s) to the main ECU without
affecting any other connections
b. An inline switchable breakout box available that allows disconnection of each TPS
signal(s) to the main ECU without affecting any other connections

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The TPS signals must be sent directly to the throttle controller using an analogue signal or via
a digital data transmission bus such as CAN or FlexRay. Any failure of the TPSs or TPS wiring
must be detectable by the controller and must be treated like Implausibility.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When an analogue signal is used, the TPSs will be considered to have failed when they achieve
an open circuit or short circuit condition which generates a signal outside of the normal
operating range, for example <0.5 V or >4.5 V.
The circuitry used to evaluate the sensor must use pull down or pull up resistors to ensure
that open circuit signals result in a failure being detected.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.4.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When any kind of digital data transmission is used to transmit the TPS signal,
a. The ETC Systems Form must contain a detailed description of all the potential failure
modes that can occur, the strategy that is used to detect these failures and the tests that
have been conducted to prove that the detection strategy works.
b. The failures to be considered must include but are not limited to the failure of the TPS,
TPS signals being out of range, corruption of the message and loss of messages and the
associated time outs.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor - APPS
Refer to T.4.2 for specific requirements of the APPS

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Brake System Encoder - BSE
Refer to T.4.3 for specific requirements of the BSE

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Brakes and Throttle Position
a. The power to the electronic throttle must be shut down if the mechanical brakes are
actuated and the TPS signals that the throttle is open by more than a permitted amount
for more than one second.
b. An interval of one second is allowed for the throttle to close (return to idle). Failure to
achieve this in the required interval must result in immediate shut down of fuel flow and
the ignition system.
c. The permitted relationship between BSE and TPS may be defined by the team using a
table. This functionality must be demonstrated at Technical Inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Throttle Position vs Target
a. The power to the electronic throttle must be immediately shut down, if throttle position
differs by more than 10% from the expected target TPS position for more than one
second.
b. An interval of one second is allowed for the difference to reduce to less than 10%, failure
to achieve this in the required interval must result in immediate shut down of fuel flow
and the ignition system.
c. An error in TPS position and the resultant system shutdown must be demonstrated at
Technical Inspection.
Teams must have a method to demonstrate that the actions in IC.4.7.2.b above are met.
System states displayed using calibration software must be accompanied by a detailed
explanation of the control system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The electronic throttle and fuel injector/ignition system shutdown must stay active until the
TPS signals indicate the throttle is at or below the unpowered default position for one second
or longer.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A standalone nonprogrammable circuit must be used to monitor the electronic throttle
control.
The BSPD must be provided in addition to the Throttle Plausibility Checks IC.4.7

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.8.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Signals from any sensors must be sent directly to the BSPD. Outputs from other modules may
not be used in place of the raw sensor signals.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.8.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BSPD must monitor for the following conditions:
a. Both of the following for more than one second:
• Demand for Hard Braking IC.4.6
• Throttle more than 10% open IC.4.4
b. Loss of signal from the braking sensor(s) for more than 100 msec
c. Loss of signal from the throttle sensor(s) for more than 100 msec
d. Removal of power from the BSPD circuit

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.8.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: When any of the above conditions exist, the BSPD must Open the Shutdown Circuit IC.9.2.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.8.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The BSPD must only be reset by cycling the Primary Master Switch IC.9.3 OFF and ON

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.8.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The BSPD must not reset when the Cockpit Main Switch IC.9.4 is turned OFF

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.4.8.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BSPD signals and function must be able to be checked during Technical Inspection by
having one of:
a. A separate set of detachable connectors for any signals from the braking sensor(s),
throttle sensor(s) and removal of power to only the BSPD device.
b. An inline switchable breakout box available that allows disconnection of the brake
sensor(s), throttle sensor(s) individually and power to only the BSPD device.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Vehicles must be operated with the fuels provided by the organizer at the competition.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fuels provided are expected to be Gasoline and E85. Consult the individual competition
websites for fuel specifics and other information.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: No agents other than the provided fuel and air may go into the combustion chamber.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Fuel System must meet the following design criteria:
a. The Fuel Tank is capable of being filled to capacity without manipulating the tank or the
vehicle in any manner.
b. During refueling on a level surface, the formation of air cavities or other effects that
cause the fuel level observed at the sight tube to drop after movement or operation of
the vehicle (other than due to consumption) are prevented.
c. Spillage during refueling cannot contact the driver position, exhaust system, hot engine
parts, or the ignition system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Fuel System location must meet IC.1.2 and F.9

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A Firewall must separate the Fuel Tank from the driver, per T.1.8

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fuel Tank
The part(s) of the fuel containment device that is in contact with the fuel.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fuel Tanks made of a rigid material must:
a. Be securely attached to the vehicle structure. The mounting method must not allow
chassis flex to load the Fuel Tank.
b. Not be used to carry any structural loads; from Roll Hoops, suspension, engine or
gearbox mounts

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Fuel Tank that is made from a flexible material, for example a bladder fuel cell or a bag
tank:
a. Must be enclosed inside a rigid fuel tank container which is securely attached to the
vehicle structure.
b. The Fuel Tank container may be load carrying

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Fuel Tank, by design, must not have a variable capacity.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.3.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Fuel System must have a provision for emptying the Fuel Tank if required.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Fuel Tanks must have a Fuel Filler Neck which must be:
a. Minimum 35 mm inner diameter at any point between the Fuel Tank and the Fuel Filler
cap

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The portion of the Fuel Filler Neck nearest to the Fuel Filler cap must be:
a. Minimum 125 mm vertical height above the top level of the Fuel Tank
b. Angled no more than 30° from the vertical

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Fuel Filler Neck must be accompanied by a clear fuel resistant sight tube for reading the
fuel level which must be:
a. Visible vertical height: 125 mm minimum
b. Inside diameter: 6 mm minimum
c. Above the top surface of the Fuel Tank

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A clear Fuel Filler Neck tube may be used as a sight tube, subject to approval by a Rules
Question or technical inspectors at the event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fuel Level Line - A permanent, non movable fuel level line must be located between 12 mm
and 25 mm below the top of the visible portion of the sight tube.
This line will be used as the fill line for the Tilt Test, and before and after Endurance to measure
the amount of fuel used during the Endurance Event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The sight tube and fuel level line must be clearly visible to two individuals (one to fill the tank,
the other to visually verify fill) without the need of assistance (artificial lighting, magnifiers,
etc) or the need to remove any parts (body panels, etc).

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The individual filling the tank must have complete direct access to the filler neck opening with
a standard two gallon gas can assembly.
The gas can is minimum 25 cm wide x 25 cm deep x 35 cm high, with a 25 cm spout at the top

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.4.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The filler neck must have a fuel cap that can withstand severe vibrations or high pressures
such as could occur during a vehicle rollover event

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Fueling / Refueling policies and procedures are at the discretion of the fuel crew and officials.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The tank will be filled to the fill line, or if a filling system is used, to the automatic stop point.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If, for any reason, the fuel level changes after the team have moved the vehicle, then no
additional fuel will be added, unless fueling after Endurance, see D.13.2.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Venting systems for the fuel tank and fuel delivery system must not allow fuel to spill during
hard cornering or acceleration.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All fuel vent lines must have a check valve to prevent fuel leakage when the tank is inverted.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.6.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All fuel vent lines must exit outside the bodywork.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Fuel lines must be securely attached to the vehicle and/or engine.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All fuel lines must be shielded from possible rotating equipment failure or collision damage.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Plastic fuel lines between the fuel tank and the engine (supply and return) are prohibited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.7.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any rubber fuel line or hose used must meet the following:
a. The components over which the hose is clamped must have annular bulb or barbed
fittings to retain the hose
b. Clamps specifically designed for fuel lines must be used.
These clamps have three features: a full 360° wrap, a nut and bolt system for tightening,
and rolled edges to prevent the clamp cutting into the hose

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.5.7.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Worm gear type hose clamps must not be used on any fuel line.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Low Pressure Injection (LPI)
Low Pressure fuel injection systems are those functioning at a pressure below 10 Bar. Most
Port Fuel Injected (PFI) fuel systems are low pressure.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Low Pressure flexible fuel lines must be one of:
• Metal braided hose with threaded fittings (crimped on or reusable)
• Reinforced rubber hose with some form of abrasion resistant protection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fuel rail and mounting requirements:
a. Unmodified OEM Fuel Rails are acceptable, regardless of material.
b. Non OEM fuel rails made from plastic, carbon fiber or rapid prototyping flammable
materials are prohibited.
c. The fuel rail must be securely attached to the manifold, engine block or cylinder head
with brackets and mechanical fasteners.
Hose clamps, plastic ties, or safety wires do not meet this requirement.
d. Threaded fasteners used to secure the fuel rail are Critical Fasteners, see T.8.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: High Pressure Injection (HPI) / Direct Injection (DI)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Definitions
a. High Pressure fuel systems - those functioning at 10 Bar pressure or above
b. Direct Injection fuel systems - where the injection occurs directly into the combustion
system
Direct Injection systems often utilize a low pressure electric fuel pump and high pressure
mechanical “boost” pump driven off the engine.
c. High Pressure Fuel Lines - those between the boost pump and injectors
d. Low Pressure Fuel Lines - from the electric supply pump to the boost pump

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All High Pressure Fuel Lines must:
a. Be stainless steel rigid line or Aeroquip FC807 smooth bore PTFE hose with stainless steel
reinforcement and visible Nomex tracer yarn. Equivalent products may be used with
prior approval.
b. Not incorporate elastomeric seals
c. Be rigidly connected every 100 mm by mechanical fasteners to structural engine
components such as cylinder heads or block

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Low Pressure flexible Fuel Lines must be one of:
• Metal braided hose with threaded fittings (crimped on or reusable)
• Reinforced rubber hose with some form of abrasion resistant protection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fuel rail mounting requirements:
a. The fuel rail must be securely attached to the engine block or cylinder head with brackets
and mechanical fasteners. Hose clamps, plastic ties, or safety wires do not meet this
requirement.
b. The fastening method must be sufficient to hold the fuel rail in place with the maximum
regulated pressure acting on the injector internals and neglecting any assistance from
cylinder pressure acting on the injector tip.
c. Threaded fasteners used to secure the fuel rail are Critical Fasteners, see T.8.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
High Pressure Fuel Pump – must be rigidly mounted to structural engine components such as
the cylinder head or engine block.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.6.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Pressure Regulator – must be fitted between the High Pressure and Low Pressure sides of the
fuel system in parallel with the DI boost pump. The external regulator must be used even if
the DI boost pump comes equipped with an internal regulator.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The exhaust system must be separated from any of the following components by means given
in T.1.6.3:
a. Flammable materials, including the fuel and fuel system, the oil and oil system
b. Thermally sensitive components, including brake lines, composite materials, and
batteries

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The exhaust must be routed to prevent the driver from fumes at any speed considering the
draft of the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Exhaust Outlet(s) must be:
a. No more than 45 cm aft of the centerline of the rear axle
b. No more than 60 cm above the ground.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any exhaust components (headers, mufflers, etc.) that protrude from the side of the body in
front of the Main Hoop must be shielded to prevent contact by persons approaching the
vehicle or a driver exiting the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fibrous/absorbent material, (such as header wrap), must not be used on the outside of an
exhaust manifold or exhaust system.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Adjustable tuning or throttling devices are permitted.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Manually adjustable tuning devices must require tools to change

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Refer to IN.10.2 for additional requirements during the Noise Test

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Connections to Exhaust
Crankcase breathers that pass through the oil catch tank(s) to exhaust systems, or vacuum
devices that connect directly to the exhaust system, are prohibited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must stay below the permitted sound level at all times IN.10.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.7.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Sound level will be verified during Technical Inspection, refer to IN.10

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Starter
Each vehicle must start the engine using an onboard starter at all times

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.8.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Batteries
Refer to T.9.2 for specific requirements of Low Voltage batteries

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.8.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Voltage between any two electrical connections must be Low Voltage T.9.1.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.8.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
This voltage limit does not apply to the following systems:
• High Voltage systems for ignition
• High Voltage systems for injectors
• Voltages internal to OEM charging systems designed for <60 V DC output.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Shutdown Circuit consists of the following components:
a. Primary Master Switch IC.9.3
b. Cockpit Main Switch IC.9.4
c. (ETC Only) Brake System Plausibility Device (BSPD) IC.4.8
d. Brake Overtravel Switch (BOTS) T.3.3
e. Inertia Switch (if used) T.9.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The team must be able to demonstrate all features and functions of the Shutdown Circuit and
components at Technical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The international electrical symbol (a red spark on a white edged blue triangle) must be near
OFF
both the Primary Master Switch and Cockpit Main Switch.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Shutdown Circuit must Open upon operation of, or detection from any of the components
listed in IC.9.1.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the Shutdown Circuit Opens, it must:
a. Stop the engine
b. Disconnect power to the:
• Fuel Pump(s)
• Ignition
• (ETC only) Electronic Throttle IC.4.1.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Configuration and Location - The Primary Master Switch must meet T.9.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Function - the Primary Master Switch must:
a. Disconnect power to ALL electrical circuits, including the battery, alternator, lights, fuel
pump(s), ignition and electrical controls.
All battery current must flow through this switch
b. Be direct acting, not act through a relay or logic.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Configuration - The Cockpit Main Switch must:
a. Be a push-pull or push-rotate emergency switch (pushing the button is the OFF position)
b. Have a diameter of 24 mm minimum

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Location – The Cockpit Main Switch must be:
a. In easy reach of the driver when in a normal driving position wearing Harness
b. Adjacent to the Steering Wheel
c. Unobstructed by the Steering Wheel or any other part of the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IC.9.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Function - the Cockpit Main Switch may act through a relay

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tractive System – TS
Every part electrically connected to the Motor(s) and/or Accumulator(s)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Grounded Low Voltage - GLV
Every electrical part that is not part of the Tractive System

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Accumulator
All the battery cells or super capacitors that store the electrical energy to be used by the
Tractive System

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.2.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each team must submit an Electrical System Form (ESF) with a clearly structured
documentation of the entire vehicle electrical system (including control and Tractive System).
Submission and approval of the ESF does not mean that the vehicle will automatically pass
Electrical Technical Inspection with the described items / parts.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.2.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The ESF may provide guidance or more details than the Formula SAE Rules.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.2.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Use the format provided and submit the ESF as given in section DR - Document Requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Submission Penalties
Penalties for the ESF are imposed as given in section DR - Document Requirements.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Supplying power to the motor to drive the vehicle in reverse is prohibited

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Drive by wire control of wheel torque is permitted

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any algorithm or electronic control unit that can adjust the requested wheel torque may only
decrease the total driver requested torque and must not increase it

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Electric Vehicles must run with the Energy Meter provided by the organizer
Refer to the FSAEOnline Website AD.2.2 for detail information on the Energy Meter

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Energy Meter must be installed in an easily accessible location

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All Tractive System power must flow through the Energy Meter

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Power and Voltage limits will be checked by the Energy Meter data
Energy is calculated as the time integrated value of the measured voltage multiplied by the
measured current logged by the Energy Meter.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The maximum power measured by the Energy Meter must not exceed 80 kW

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The maximum permitted voltage that may occur between any two points must not exceed
600 V DC

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The powertrain must not regenerate energy when vehicle speed is between 0 and 5 km/hr

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A Violation occurs when one or two of these exist:
a. Use of more than the specified maximum power EV.3.3.1
b. Exceed the maximum voltage EV.3.3.2
for one or both conditions:
• Continuously for 100 ms or more
• After a moving average over 500 ms is applied

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Missing Energy Meter data due to the team’s fault, tampering, or attempting to tamper with
the Energy Meter will be treated as a Violation.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tampering, or attempting to tamper with the Energy Meter or its data may result in
Disqualification (DQ)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Violations during the Acceleration, Skidpad, Autocross Events:
a. Each run with one or more Violations will Disqualify (DQ) the best run of the team
b. Multiple runs with Violations will DQ multiple runs, ex two runs with Violations DQ the
two best runs

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Violations during the Endurance event:
• Each Violation: 60 second penalty D.14.2.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Repeated Violations may void Inspection Approval or receive additional penalties up to and
including Disqualification, subject to official discretion.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.3.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The respective data of each run in which a team has a Violation and the resulting decision may
be made public.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Only electrical motors are allowed. The number of motors is not limited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If used, Outboard Wheel Motors, where the motor, attendant cables and wiring do not meet
F.11.1.3, must:
a. Include an Interlock EV.7.8
This Interlock(s) must Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2 before failure of the Tractive
System wiring when the wiring is damaged or the Wheel/Motor assembly is damaged or
knocked off the vehicle.
b. Reduce the length of the portions of wiring and other connections that do not meet
F.11.1.3 to the extent possible

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Motor Controller
The Tractive System Motor(s) must be connected to the Accumulator through a Motor
Controller. No direct connections between Motor(s) and Accumulator.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accumulator Container(s) must be removable from the vehicle while still remaining rules
compliant

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accumulator Container(s) must be completely closed at all times (when mounted to the
vehicle and when removed from the vehicle) without the need to install extra protective
covers

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accumulator Container(s) may contain Holes or Openings
a. Only the wiring harness, ventilation, cooling and fasteners may pass through holes in the
Accumulator Container(s)
b. Holes and Openings in the Accumulator Container must meet F.10.4
c. External holes must meet EV.6.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.3.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Accumulators that may vent an explosive gas must have a ventilation system or pressure
relief valve to release the vented gas

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.3.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Completely sealed Accumulator Containers must have a pressure relief valve

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.3.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Pressure relief valves must not have line of sight to the driver, with the Firewall installed or
removed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.3.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each Accumulator Container must be labelled with the:
a. School Name and Vehicle Number
b. Symbol specified in ISO 7010-W012 (triangle with black lightning bolt on yellow
background) with triangle side length of 100 mm minimum
c. Text “Always Energized”
d. Text “High Voltage” if the voltage meets T.9.1.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The GLV System must be:
a. A Low Voltage system that is Grounded to the Chassis
b. Able to operate with Accumulator removed from the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The GLV System must include a Master Switch, see EV.7.9.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A GLV Measuring Point (GLVMP) must be installed which is:
a. Connected to GLV System Ground
b. Next to the TSMP EV.5.8
c. 4 mm shrouded banana jack
d. Color: Black
e. Marked “GND”

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor - APPS
Refer to T.4.2 for specific requirements of the APPS

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Brake System Encoder - BSE
Refer to T.4.3 for specific requirements of the BSE

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Must monitor for the two conditions:
• The mechanical brakes are engaged EV.4.6, T.3.2.4
• The APPS signals more than 25% Pedal Travel EV.4.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the two conditions in EV.4.7.1 occur at the same time:
a. Power to the Motor(s) must be immediately and completely shut down
b. The Motor shut down must stay active until the APPS signals less than 5% Pedal Travel,
with or without brake operation
The team must be able to demonstrate these actions at Technical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tractive System Part Positioning
All parts belonging to the Tractive System must meet F.10.5.8

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Every housing or enclosure containing parts of the Tractive System other than Motor
housings, must be labelled with the:
a. Symbol specified in ISO 7010-W012 (triangle with black lightning bolt on yellow
background)
b. Text “High Voltage” if the voltage meets T.9.1.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the material of the housing containing parts of the Tractive System is electrically conductive,
it must have a low resistance connection to GLV System Ground, see EV.6.7

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.10.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Teams must have a Hand Cart to transport their Accumulator Container(s)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.10.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Hand Cart must be used when the Accumulator Container(s) are transported on the
competition site EV.11.4.2 EV.11.5.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.10.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Hand Cart must:
a. Be able to carry the load of the Accumulator Container(s) without tipping over
b. Contain a minimum of two wheels
c. Have a brake that must be:
• Released only using a dead man type switch (where the brake is always on except
when released by pushing and holding a handle) or by manually lifting part of the
cart off the ground
• Able to stop the Hand Cart with a fully loaded Accumulator Container

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.4.10.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Accumulator Container(s) must be securely attached to the Hand Cart

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All cells or super capacitors which store the Tractive System energy are built into Accumulator
Segments and must be enclosed in (an) Accumulator Container(s).

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each Accumulator Segment must contain:
• Maximum static voltage of less than 120 V DC
• Maximum energy of 6 MJ
The contained energy of a stack is calculated by multiplying the maximum stack voltage with
the nominal capacity of the used cell(s).

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
No further energy storage except for reasonably sized intermediate circuit capacitors are
allowed after the Energy Meter EV.3.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Accumulator Segments and/or Accumulator Containers (including spares and replacement
parts) must be identical to the design documented in the ESF and SES

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All Tractive System components must be rated for the maximum Tractive System voltage

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the Accumulator Container is made from an electrically conductive material:
a. The poles of the Accumulator Segment(s) and/or cells must be isolated from the inner
wall of the Accumulator Container with an insulating material that is rated for the
maximum Tractive System voltage.
b. All conductive surfaces on the outside of the Accumulator Container must have a low
resistance connection to the GLV System Ground, see EV.6.7
c. Any conductive penetrations, such as mounting hardware, must be protected against
puncturing the insulating barrier.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each Accumulator Segment must be electrically insulated with suitable Nonflammable
Material (F.1.18) (not air) for the two:
a. Between the segments in the container
b. On top of the segment
The intent is to prevent arc flashes caused by inter segment contact or by parts/tools
accidentally falling into the container during maintenance for example.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Soldering electrical connections in the high current path is prohibited
Soldering wires to cells for the voltage monitoring input of the AMS is allowed, these wires are
not part of the high current path.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Every wire used in an Accumulator Container, whether it is part of the GLV or Tractive System,
must be rated to the maximum Tractive System voltage.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Maintenance Plugs must allow electrical separation of the Accumulator Segments to meet:
a. The separated Segments meet voltage and energy limits of EV.5.1.2
b. The separation must affect both poles of the Segment

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Maintenance Plugs must:
a. Require the physical removal or separation of a component. Contactors or switches are
not acceptable Maintenance Plugs
b. Have access after opening the Accumulator Container and not necessary to move or
remove any other components
c. Not be physically possible to connect in any configuration other than the design intended
configuration
d. Not require tools to install or remove
e. Include a positive locking feature which prevents the plug from unintentionally becoming
loose
f. Be nonconductive on surfaces that do not provide any electrical connection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the Accumulator Containers are opened or Segments are removed, the Accumulator
Segments must be separated by using the Maintenance Plugs. See EV.11.4.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Every Accumulator Container must contain minimum one fuse (EV.6.6) and two or more
Accumulator Isolation Relays (AIR)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accumulator Isolation Relays must:
a. Be a Normally Open type
b. Open both poles of the Accumulator

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the AIRs are open, High Voltage T.9.1.1 must not be external of the Accumulator
Container

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accumulator Isolation Relays and any fuses must be separated from the rest of the
Accumulator with an electrically insulated and Nonflammable Material (F.1.18).

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A capacitor may be used to hold the AIRs closed for up to 250 ms after the Shutdown Circuit
Opens EV.7.2.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
High Voltage Disconnect - HVD
A High Voltage Disconnect (HVD) must be included to quickly disconnect one or both poles of
the Accumulator EV.11.3.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The High Voltage Disconnect (HVD) must be:
a. A directly accessible element, fuse or connector
b. More than 350 mm from the ground
c. Easily visible when standing behind the vehicle
d. Operable in 10 seconds or less by an untrained person
e. Operable without removing any bodywork or obstruction or using tools
f. Directly operated. Remote operation through a long handle, rope or wire is not
acceptable.
g. Clearly marked with "HVD"

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: An Interlock EV.7.8 must Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2 when the HVD is removed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A dummy connector or similar may be used to restore isolation to meet EV.6.1.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accumulator must contain a Precharge Circuit. The Precharge Circuit must:
a. Be able to charge the Intermediate Circuit to minimum 90% of the Accumulator voltage
before closing the second AIR
b. Be supplied from the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.1
c. Not be fused

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Intermediate Circuit must precharge before closing the second AIR. The end of precharge
must be controlled by one of the following two options:
a. Feedback by monitoring the voltage in the Intermediate Circuit
b. A conservative time defined by the longer of:
• Twice the time to charge to 90%
• The time to charge to 90% plus 500ms

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.6.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Tractive System must contain a Discharge Circuit. The Discharge Circuit must be:
a. Wired in a way that it is always active when the Shutdown Circuit is open
b. Able to discharge the Intermediate Circuit capacitors if the HVD has been opened
c. Not be fused
d. Designed to handle the maximum Tractive System voltage for minimum 15 seconds

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.6.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Positive Temperature Coefficient (PTC) devices must not be used to limit current for the
Precharge Circuit or Discharge Circuit

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.6.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The precharge relay must be a mechanical type relay

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Voltage Indicator
Each Accumulator Container must have a prominent indicator when High Voltage T.9.1.1 is
present at the vehicle side of the AIRs

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Voltage Indicator must always function, including when the Accumulator Container is
disconnected or removed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The voltage being present at the connectors must directly control the Voltage Indicator using
hard wired electronics with no software control.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The control signal which closes the AIRs must not control the Voltage Indicator

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.7.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Voltage Indicator must:
a. Be located where it is clearly visible when connecting/disconnecting the Accumulator
Tractive System connections
b. Be labeled “High Voltage Present”

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Two Tractive System Measuring Points (TSMP) must be installed in the vehicle which are:
a. Connected to the positive and negative motor controller/inverter supply lines
b. Next to the Master Switches EV.7.9
c. Protected by a nonconductive housing that can be opened without tools
d. Protected from being touched with bare hands / fingers once the housing is opened

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.8.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Two TSMPs must be installed in the Charger EV.8.2 which are:
a. Connected to the positive and negative Charger output lines
b. Available during charging of any Accumulator(s)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.8.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The TSMPs must be:
a. 4 mm shrouded banana jacks rated to an appropriate voltage level
b. Color: Red
c. Marked “HV+” and “HV-“

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.8.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Any TSMP must not contain additional Overcurrent Protection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must include a Tractive Systems Active Light (TSAL) that must:
a. Illuminate when the GLV System is energized to indicate the status of the Tractive
System
b. Be directly controlled by the voltage present in the Tractive System using hard wired
electronics. Software control is not permitted.
c. Not perform any other functions.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The TSAL may be composed of multiple lights inside a single housing

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.9.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the voltage outside the Accumulator Container(s) exceeds T.9.1.1, the TSAL must:
a. Be Color: Red
b. Flash with a frequency between 2 Hz and 5 Hz

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.9.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the voltage outside the Accumulator Container(s) is below T.9.1.1, the TSAL must:
a. Be Color: Green
b. Stay continuously illuminated

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.9.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The TSAL mounting location must:
a. Be near the Main Hoop at the highest point of the vehicle.
b. Be inside the Rollover Protection Envelope F.1.13
c. Be no lower than 150 mm from the highest point of the Main Hoop.
d. Not allow contact with the driver’s helmet in any circumstances.
e. Not be in proximity to other lights.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.9.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The TSAL must be visible:
a. From every horizontal direction, except small angles which are blocked by the Main Hoop
b. From a point 1.6 m vertically from ground level, inside a 3 m horizontal radius from the
TSAL
c. In direct sunlight

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.5.10 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Connectors
Tractive System connectors outside of a housing must meet one of the two:
• Contain an Interlock EV.7.8 which must Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2
• Be sealed at Tech Inspection IN.4.7.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Nonconductive material or covers must prevent inadvertent human contact with any Tractive
System voltage.
Covers must be secure and sufficiently rigid.
Removable Bodywork is not suitable to enclose Tractive System connections.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Contact with any Tractive System connections with a 100 mm long, 6 mm diameter insulated
test probe must not be possible when the Tractive System enclosures are in place.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tractive System components and Accumulator Containers must be protected from moisture,
rain or puddles.
A rating of IP65 is recommended

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Insulation material must:
a. Be appropriate for the expected surrounding temperatures
b. Have a minimum temperature rating of 90°C

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Insulating tape or paint may be part of the insulation, but must not be the only insulation.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All wires and terminals and other conductors used in the Tractive System must be sized for the
continuous current they will conduct

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Tractive System wiring must:
a. Be marked with wire gauge, temperature rating and insulation voltage rating.
A serial number or a norm printed on the wire is sufficient if this serial number or norm is
clearly bound to the wire characteristics for example by a data sheet.
b. Have temperature rating more than or equal to 90°C

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tractive System wiring must be:
a. Done to professional standards with sufficient strain relief
b. Protected from loosening due to vibration
c. Protected against damage by rotating and / or moving parts
d. Located out of the way of possible snagging or damage
