question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Tractive System wiring that runs outside of electrical enclosures:
a. Must meet one of:
• Enclosed in separate orange nonconductive conduit
• Use an orange shielded cable.
b. Must meet one of:
• Run in a fully enclosed container. Bodywork is not an enclosure.
• The conduit or shielded cable is securely anchored at each end to allow it to
withstand a force of 200 N without straining the cable end crimp
c. Any shielded cable must have the shield grounded.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.3.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Wiring that is not part of the Tractive System must not use orange wiring or conduit.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Tractive System connections must:
a. Be designed to use intentional current paths through conductors designed for electrical
current
b. Not rely on steel bolts to be the primary conductor
c. Not include compressible material such as plastic in the stack-up

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If external, uninsulated heat sinks are used, they must be properly grounded to the GLV
System Ground, see EV.6.7

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Bolted electrical connections in the high current path of the Tractive System must include a
positive locking feature to prevent unintentional loosening
Lock washers or thread locking compounds (Loctite®) or adhesives are not acceptable.
Bolts with nylon patches are allowed for blind connections into OEM components.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Information about the electrical connections supporting the high current path must be
available at Electrical Technical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Separation of Tractive System and GLV System:
a. The entire Tractive System and GLV System must be completely galvanically separated.
b. The border between Tractive and GLV System is the galvanic isolation between both
systems. Therefore, some components, such as the Motor Controller, may be part of
both systems.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
There must be no connection between the Chassis of the vehicle (or any other conductive
surface that might be inadvertently touched by a person), and any part of any Tractive System
circuits.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tractive System and GLV circuits must not run through the same conduit or connector, except
as allowed in EV.7.8.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
GLV Systems other than the AIRs EV.5.4, parts of the Precharge and Discharge Circuits EV.5.6,
HV DC/DC converters, the AMS EV.7.3, the IMD EV.7.6, parts of the TSAL EV.5.9.1 the Energy
Meter EV.3.1 and cooling fans must not be inside the Accumulator Container.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.5.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Spacing must be clearly defined. Components and cables capable of movement must be
positively restrained to maintain spacing.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.5.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Teams must be prepared to show spacing on team built equipment
For inaccessible circuitry, spare boards or appropriate photographs must be available for
inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.5.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All connections to external devices such as laptops from a Tractive System component must
include galvanic isolation.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All electrical systems (both Low Voltage and High Voltage) must have appropriate Overcurrent
Protection/Fusing.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Unless otherwise allowed in the Rules, all Overcurrent Protection devices must:
a. Be rated for the highest voltage in the systems they protect.
Overcurrent Protection devices used for DC must be rated for DC and must carry a DC
rating equal to or more than the system voltage
b. Have a continuous current rating less than or equal to the continuous current rating of
any electrical component that it protects
c. Have an interrupt current rating higher than the theoretical short circuit current of the
system that it protects

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.6.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each parallel element of multiple parallel battery cells, capacitors, strings of battery cells,
strings of capacitors, or conductors must have individual Overcurrent Protection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.6.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any conductors (wires, busbars, etc) conducting the entire pack current must meet one of:
a. Be appropriately sized for the total current that the individual Overcurrent Protection
devices could transmit
b. Contain additional Overcurrent Protection to protect the conductors

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.6.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Battery packs with Low Voltage or non voltage rated fusible links for cell connections may be
used when all three conditions are met:
• An Overcurrent Protection device rated at less than or equal to one third the sum of the
parallel fusible links and complying with EV.6.6.2.b above is connected in series.
• The AMS can detect an open fusible link and will Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2 if a
fault is detected.
• Fusible link current rating is specified in manufacturer’s data or suitable test data is
provided.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.6.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If conductor ampacity is reduced below the ampacity of the upstream Overcurrent Protection,
the reduced conductor longer than 150 mm must have additional Overcurrent Protection.
This additional Overcurrent Protection must be:
a. 150 mm or less from the source end of the reduced conductor
b. On both positive and negative conductors in the Tractive System
c. On the positive conductor in the Grounded Low Voltage System

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.6.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cells with internal Overcurrent Protection may be used without external Overcurrent
Protection if suitably rated.
Most cell internal Overcurrent Protection devices are Low Voltage or non voltage rated and
conditions of EV.6.6.5 above will apply.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Grounding is required for:
a. Parts of the vehicle which are 100 mm or less from any Tractive System component
b. The Tractive System Firewall T.1.9

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Grounded parts of the vehicle must have a resistance to GLV System Ground less than the
values specified below.
a. Electrically conductive parts 300 mOhms (measured with a current of 1 A)
Examples: parts made of steel, (anodized) aluminum, any other metal parts
b. Parts which may become electrically conductive 5 Ohm
Example: carbon fiber parts
Carbon fiber parts may need special measures such as using copper mesh or similar to
keep the ground resistance below 5 Ohms.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.6.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Electrical conductivity of any part may be tested by checking any point which is likely to be
conductive.
Where no convenient conductive point is available, an area of coating may be removed.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Shutdown Circuit consists of the following components, connected in series:
a. Accumulator Management System (AMS) EV.7.3
b. Insulation Monitoring Device (IMD) EV.7.6
c. Brake System Plausibility Device (BSPD) EV.7.7
d. Interlocks (as required) EV.7.8
e. Master Switches (GLVMS, TSMS) EV.7.9
f. Shutdown Buttons EV.7.10
g. Brake Over Travel Switch (BOTS) T.3.3
h. Inertia Switch T.9.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Shutdown Circuit must directly carry the current driving the Accumulator Isolation Relays
(AIRs) and the Precharge Circuit Relay.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The AMS, IMD, and BSPD parts of the Shutdown Circuit must be Normally Open

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The AMS, IMD and BSPD must have completely independent circuits to Open the Shutdown
Circuit.
The design of the respective circuits must ensure that a failure cannot result in electrical
power being fed back into the Shutdown Circuit.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Shutdown Buttons, BOTS, TSMS, GLVMS and Interlocks must directly carry the Shutdown
Circuit current

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.1.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The team must be able to demonstrate all features and functions of the Shutdown Circuit and
components at Electrical Technical Inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Shutdown Circuit must Open when any of the following exist:
a. Operation of, or detection from any of the components listed in EV.7.1.1
b. Any shutdown of the GLV System

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the Shutdown Circuit Opens:
a. The Tractive System must Shutdown
b. All Accumulator current flow must stop immediately EV.5.4.3
c. The voltage in the Tractive System must be Low Voltage T.9.1.2 in five seconds or less
d. The Motor(s) must spin free. Torque must not be applied to the Motor(s)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the AMS, IMD or BSPD Open the Shutdown Circuit:
a. The Tractive System must stay disabled until manually reset
b. The Tractive System must be reset only by manual action of a person directly at the
vehicle
c. The driver must not be able to reactivate the Tractive System from inside the vehicle
d. Operation of the Shutdown Buttons or TSMS must not reset the Shutdown Circuit

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The driver may reset the Shutdown Circuit from the cockpit, subject to EV.7.2.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
An Accumulator Management System must monitor the Accumulator(s) Voltage EV.7.4 and
Temperature EV.7.5 when the:
a. Tractive System is Active EV.11.5
b. Accumulator is connected to a Charger EV.8.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The AMS must have galvanic isolation at every segment to segment boundary, as approved in
the ESF

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Cell balancing is not permitted when the Shutdown Circuit is Open ( EV.7.2, EV.8.4 )

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The AMS must monitor for:
a. Voltage values outside the allowable range EV.7.4.2
b. Voltage sense Overcurrent Protection device(s) blown or tripped
c. Temperature values outside the allowable range EV.7.5.2
d. Missing or interrupted voltage or temperature measurements
e. A fault in the AMS

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.3.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the AMS detects one or more of the conditions of EV.7.3.4 above, the AMS must:
a. Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2
b. Turn on the AMS Indicator Light. The light must stay on until the AMS is reset EV.7.2.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.3.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The AMS Indicator Light must be:
a. Color: Red
b. Clearly visible to the seated driver in bright sunlight
c. Clearly marked with the lettering “AMS”

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The AMS must measure the cell voltage of every cell
When single cells are directly connected in parallel, only one voltage measurement is needed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cell Voltage levels must stay inside the allowed minimum and maximum cell voltage levels
stated in the cell data sheet. Measurement accuracy must be considered.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All voltage sense wires to the AMS must meet one of:
a. Have Overcurrent Protection EV.7.4.4 below
b. Meet requirements for no Overcurrent Protection listed in EV.7.4.5 below

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When used, Overcurrent Protection for the AMS voltage sense wires must meet the following.
a. The Overcurrent Protection must occur in the conductor, wire or PCB trace which is
directly connected to the cell tab.
b. The voltage rating of the Overcurrent Protection must be equal to or higher than the
maximum segment voltage

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Overcurrent Protection is not required on a voltage sense wire if all three of the following
conditions are met:
• AMS is a distributed AMS system (one cell measurement per board)
• Sense wire length is less than 25 mm
• AMS board has Overcurrent Protection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The AMS must measure the temperatures of critical points of the Accumulator

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Temperatures (considering measurement accuracy) must stay below the lower of the two:
• The maximum cell temperature limit stated in the cell data sheet
• 60°C

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Cell temperatures must be measured at the negative terminal of the respective cell

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The temperature sensor used must be in direct contact with one of:
• The negative terminal itself
• The negative terminal busbar less than 10 mm away from the cell terminal

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.5.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
For lithium based cells,
a. The temperature of a minimum of 20% of the cells must be monitored by the AMS
b. The monitored cells must be equally distributed inside the Accumulator Container(s)
Every cell temperature should be monitored

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.5.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Multiple cells may be monitored with one temperature sensor, if EV.7.5 is met for all cells
sensed by the sensor.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.5.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Temperature sensors must have appropriate electrical isolation that meets one of the two:
• Between the sensor and cell
• In the sensing circuit
The isolation must consider both GLV/TS isolation as well as common mode voltages between
sense locations.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must have an Insulation Monitoring Device (IMD) installed in the Tractive System

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The IMD must be a Bender ISOMETER® IR155-3203 or IR155-3204 (website) or an approved
alternate equivalent IMD
Refer to the Rules FAQ on the FSAE Online website for approved equivalent IMD

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.6.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The response value of the IMD must be set to 500 Ohm / Volt or higher, related to the
maximum Tractive System operation voltage.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.6.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The IMD must monitor the Tractive System for:
a. An isolation failure
b. A failure in the IMD operation
This must be done without the influence of any programmable logic.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.6.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the IMD detects one or more of the conditions of EV.7.6.4 above the IMD must:
a. Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2
b. Turn on the IMD Indicator Light. The light must stay on until the IMD is reset EV.7.2.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.6.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The IMD Indicator Light must be:
a. Color: Red
b. Clearly visible to the seated driver in bright sunlight
c. Clearly marked with the lettering “IMD”

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must have a standalone nonprogrammable circuit to check for simultaneous
braking and high power output
The BSPD must be provided in addition to the APPS / Brake Pedal Plausibility Check (EV.4.7)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BSPD must Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2 when the two of these exist:
• Demand for Hard Braking EV.4.6
• Motor/Accumulator current is at a level where 5 kW of electrical power in the DC circuit
is delivered to the Motor(s) at the nominal battery voltage
The BSPD may delay opening the shutdown circuit up to 0.5 sec to avoid false trips

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BSPD must Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2 when there is an open or short circuit in
any sensor input

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.7.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The team must have a test to demonstrate BSPD operation at Electrical Technical Inspection.
a. Power must not be sent to the Motor(s) of the vehicle during the test
b. The test must prove the function of the complete BSPD in the vehicle, including the
current sensor
The suggested test would introduce a current by a separate wire from an external power
supply simulating the Tractive System current while pressing the brake pedal

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Interlocks must be incorporated where specified (refer to EV.4.1.3, EV.5.5.2, EV.5.10 )

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.8.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Additional Interlocks may be included in the Tractive System or components

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.8.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Interlock is a wire or connection that must:
a. Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2 if the Interlock connection is broken or interrupted
b. Not be in the low (ground) connection to the AIR coils of the Shutdown Circuit

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.8.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Interlock circuits or connections do not require physical separation (EV.6.5) from Tractive
System wiring or components

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each vehicle must have two Master Switches that must:
a. Meet T.9.3 for Configuration and Location
b. Be direct acting, not act through a relay or logic

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Grounded Low Voltage Master Switch (GLVMS) must:
a. Completely stop all power to the GLV System EV.4.4
b. Be in the center of a completely red circular area of > 50 mm in diameter
c. Be labeled “LV”

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.9.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Tractive System Master Switch (TSMS) must:
a. Open the Shutdown Circuit in the OFF position EV.7.2.2
b. Be the last switch before the AIRs except for Precharge circuitry and Interlocks.
c. Be in the center of a completely orange circular area of > 50 mm in diameter
d. Be labeled “TS” and the symbol specified in ISO 7010-W012 (triangle with black
lightning bolt on yellow background).
e. Be fitted with a "lockout/tagout" capability in the OFF position EV.11.3.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.10.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Three Shutdown Buttons must be installed on the vehicle.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.10.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Each Shutdown Button must be a push-pull or push-rotate emergency switch

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.10.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
One Shutdown Button must be on each side of the vehicle which:
a. Is located aft of the driver’s compartment at approximately the level of the driver’s head
b. Has a diameter of 40 mm minimum
c. Must not be easily removable or mounted onto removable body work

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.10.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
One Shutdown Button must be mounted in the cockpit which:
a. Is located in easy reach of the belted in driver, adjacent to the steering wheel, and
unobstructed by the steering wheel or any other part of the vehicle
b. Has diameter of 24 mm minimum

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.10.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The international electrical symbol (a red spark on a white edged blue triangle) must be near
OFF
each Shutdown Button.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.7.10.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Pressing any of the Shutdown Buttons must Open the Shutdown Circuit EV.7.2.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All features and functions of the Charger and Charging Shutdown Circuit must be
demonstrated at Electrical Technical Inspection. IN.4.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Chargers will be sealed after approval. IN.4.7.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Charger must be galvanically isolated (AC) input to (DC) output.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: If the Charger housing is conductive it must be connected to the earth ground of the AC input.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All connections of the Charger(s) must be isolated and covered.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Charger connector(s) must incorporate a feature to let the connector become live only
when correctly connected to the Accumulator.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: High Voltage charging leads must be orange

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Charger must have two TSMPs installed, see EV.5.8.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.2.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Charger must include a Charger Shutdown Button which is:
a. A push-pull or push-rotate emergency switch
b. Minimum diameter of 25 mm
c. Labelled with the international electrical symbol (a red spark on a white edged blue
OFF
triangle)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Charging Shutdown Circuit consists of:
a. Charger Shutdown Button EV.8.2.7
b. Accumulator Management System (AMS) EV.7.3
c. Insulation Monitoring Device (IMD) EV.7.6

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The AMS and IMD parts of the Charging Shutdown Circuit must:
a. Be designed as Normally Open contacts
b. Have completely independent circuits to Open the Charging Shutdown Circuit.
Design of the respective circuits must ensure that a failure cannot result in electrical
power being fed back into the Charging Shutdown Circuit.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When Charging, the AMS and IMD must:
a. Monitor the Accumulator
b. Open the Charging Shutdown Circuit if a fault is detected.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.8.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the Charging Shutdown Circuit Opens:
a. All current flow to the Accumulator must stop immediately
b. The voltage in the Tractive System must be Low Voltage T.9.1.2 in five seconds or less
c. The Charger must be turned off
d. The Charger must stay disabled until manually reset

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Activation Sequence
The vehicle systems must energize in the following sequence:
a. Low Voltage (GLV) System EV.9.2
b. Tractive System Active EV.9.3
c. Ready to Drive EV.9.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Low Voltage (GLV) System
The Shutdown Circuit may be Closed when or after the GLV System is energized EV.7.2.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Definition – High Voltage is present outside of the Accumulator Container

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tractive System Active must not be possible until both:
• GLV System is Energized
• Shutdown Circuit is Closed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Definition – the Motor(s) will respond to the input of the APPS

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Ready to Drive must not be possible until the three at the same time:
• Tractive System Active EV.9.3
• The Brake Pedal is pressed and held to engage the mechanical brakes T.3.2
• The driver performs a manual action to initiate Ready to Drive
Such as pressing a specific button in the cockpit

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must make a characteristic sound when it is Ready to Drive

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Ready to Drive Sound must be:
a. Sounded continuously for minimum 1 second and maximum 3 seconds
b. A minimum sound level of 80 dBA, fast weighting IN.4.6
c. Easily recognizable. No animal voices, song parts or sounds that could be interpreted as
offensive will be accepted

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.9.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must not make other sounds similar to the Ready to Drive Sound.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.10.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Accumulator must be onsite at the time the team registers to be eligible for Accumulator
Technical Inspection and Dynamic Events

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.10.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Teams who register without the Accumulator:
a. Must not bring their Accumulator onsite for the duration of the competition
b. May participate in Technical Inspection and Static Events

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.10.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
After the team registers onsite, the Accumulator must remain on the competition site until
the end of the competition, or the team withdraws and leaves the site

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.10.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Violators will be disqualified from the competition and must leave immediately

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Electrical System Officer (ESO): AD.5.2
a. Is the only person on the team that may declare the vehicle electrically safe to allow
work on any system
b. Must accompany the vehicle when operated or moved at the competition site
c. Must be immediately available by phone at all times during the event

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All participating team members must wear safety glasses with side shields at any time when:
a. Parts of the Tractive System are exposed while energized
b. Work is performed on the Accumulators

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Appropriate insulated tools must be used when working on the Accumulator or Tractive
System

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The TSMS EV.7.9.3 must be locked in the OFF position when any work is done on the vehicle.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The HVD EV.5.5 must be disconnected when vehicles are:
a. Moved around the competition site
b. Participating in Static Events

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The following work activities at competition are allowed only in the designated area and
during Electrical Technical Inspection IN.4 See EV.5.3.3
a. Opening Accumulator Containers
b. Any work on Accumulators, cells, or Segments
c. Energized electrical work

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Accumulator cells and/or Accumulator Segment(s) must be moved at the competition site
inside one of the two:
a. Completely closed Accumulator Container EV.4.3 See EV.4.10.2
b. Segment/Cell Transport Container EV.11.4.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Segment/Cell Transport Container(s) must be:
a. Electrically insulated
b. Protected from shock hazards and arc flash

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Segments/Cells inside the Transport Container must agree with the voltage and energy limits
of EV.5.1.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Accumulators must be removed from the vehicle inside the Accumulator Container and placed
on the Accumulator Container Hand Cart EV.4.10 for Charging.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Accumulator Charging must occur only inside the designated area

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A team member(s) who has knowledge of the Charging process must stay with the
Accumulator(s) during Charging

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each Accumulator Container(s) must have a label with the following data during Charging:
Team name and Electrical System Officer phone number(s)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule EV.11.5.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Additional site specific rules or policies may apply

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inspection Required
Each vehicle must pass all applicable parts of Technical Inspection, receive Inspection
Approval IN.13.1 and show the Inspection Sticker IN.13.2 before it may participate in any
Dynamic event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.1.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The exact procedures and instruments used for inspection and testing are entirely at the
discretion of the Chief Technical Inspector(s).

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.1.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Decisions of the Chief Technical Inspector(s) and the Organizer concerning vehicle compliance
are final.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Team Responsibility
Teams must make sure that their vehicle, and the required equipment, obeys the Formula SAE
Rules before Technical Inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Reinspection
Officials may Reinspect any vehicle at any time during the competition IN.15

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicles must be presented for Technical Inspection in finished condition, fully assembled,
complete and ready to run.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Technical inspectors will not inspect any vehicle presented for inspection in an unfinished
state.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Allowable dimensions are absolute, and do not have any tolerance unless specifically stated.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: No allowance is given for measurement accuracy or error.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Visible Access
All items on the Technical Inspection Form must be clearly visible to the technical inspectors
without using instruments such as endoscopes or mirrors.
Methods to provide visible access include but are not limited to removable body panels, access
panels, and other components

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Technical Inspection will examine all items included on the Technical Inspection Form to make
sure the vehicle and other equipment obeys the Rules.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Technical Inspectors may examine any other items at their discretion

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Correction
If any part of a vehicle does not comply with the rules, or is otherwise a concern, the team
must:
• Correct the problem
• Continue Inspection or have the vehicle Reinspected

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Officials may mark, seal, or designate items or areas which have been inspected to document
the inspection and reduce the chance of tampering

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.2.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Damaged or lost marks or seals require Reinspection IN.15

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
INITIAL INSPECTION
Bring these to Initial Inspection:
• Technical Inspection Form
• All Driver Equipment per VE.3 to be used by each driver
• Fire Extinguishers (for paddock and vehicle) VE.2.3
• Wet Tires V.4.3.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: ELECTRICAL TECHNICAL INSPECTION (EV ONLY)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inspection Items
Bring these to Electrical Technical Inspection:
• Charger(s) for the Accumulator(s) EV.8.1
• Accumulator Container Hand Cart EV.4.10
• Spare Accumulator(s) (if applicable) EV.5.1.4
• Electrical Systems Form (ESF) and Component Data Sheets EV.2
• Copies of any submitted Rules Questions with the received answer GR.7
The following basic tools in good condition:
• Insulated cable shears
• Insulated screw drivers
• Multimeter with protected probe tips
• Insulated tools, if screwed connections are used in the Tractive System
• Face Shield
• HV insulating gloves which are 12 months or less from their test date
• Two HV insulating blankets of minimum 0.83 m² each
• Safety glasses with side shields for all team members that might work on the Tractive
System or Accumulator

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Accumulator Inspection
The Accumulator(s) and associated equipment (Hand Cart, Chargers, etc) may be inspected
during Electrical Technical Inspection, or separately from the rest of Electrical Technical
Inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the Accumulator Container(s) is not easily accessible during Electrical Tech Inspection,
provide detailed pictures of the internals taken during assembly

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Tech inspectors may require access to check any Accumulator(s) for rules compliance

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Insulation Monitoring Device will be tested by connecting a resistor between the Tractive
System Measuring Points (EV.5.8), and several electrically conductive vehicle parts while the
Tractive System is active

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The test passes if the IMD shuts down the Tractive System in 30 seconds or less at a fault
resistance of 50% below the response value corresponding to 250 Ohm / Volt

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The insulation resistance between the Tractive System and GLV System Ground will be
measured.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The available measurement voltages are 250 V and 500 V. All vehicles with a maximum
nominal operation voltage below 500 V will be measured with the next available voltage level.
All teams with a system voltage of 500 V or more will be measured with 500 V.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
To pass the Insulation Measurement Test the measured insulation resistance must be
minimum 500 Ohm/Volt related to the maximum nominal Tractive System operation voltage.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Ready to Drive Sound
The sound level will be measured with a free field microphone placed free from obstructions
in a radius of 2 m around the vehicle against the criteria in EV.9.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All or portions of the Tractive System, Charger and other components may be sealed IN.2.6

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Additional monitoring to verify conformance to rules may be installed. Refer to the Event
Website for further information.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.4.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Electric Vehicles must pass Electrical Technical Inspection and Mechanical Technical Inspection
before the vehicle may attempt any further Inspections. See EV.11.3.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
DRIVER COCKPIT CHECKS
The Clearance Checks and Egress Test may be performed separately or in conjunction with
other parts of Technical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Driver Clearance
Each driver in the normal driving position is checked for the three:
• Helmet clearance F.5.6.3
• Head Restraint positioning T.2.8.5
• Harness fit and adjustment T.2.5, T.2.6, T.2.7

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.5.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Each driver must be able to exit to the side of the vehicle in no more than 5 seconds.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.5.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Egress Test will be conducted for each driver as follows:
a. The driver must wear the specified Driver Equipment VE.3.2, VE.3.3
b. Egress time begins with the driver in the fully seated position, with hands in driving
position on the connected steering wheel.
c. Egress test may have the driver touch the (IC) Cockpit Main Switch IC.9.4 (EV) Shutdown
Button EV.7.10.4
d. Egress time will stop when the driver has both feet on the pavement.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Driver Clearance and Egress Test Completion

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.5.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
To drive the vehicle, each team driver must:
a. Meet the Driver Clearance requirements IN.5.1
b. Successfully complete the Egress Test IN.5.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.5.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A driver(s) must complete the Driver Cockpit Checks to pass Mechanical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
DRIVER TEMPLATE INSPECTIONS
The Driver Template Inspection will be conducted as part of the Mechanical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Conduct
The Driver Template shown in F.5.6.4 will be positioned as given in F.5.6.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Driver Template Clearance Criteria
To pass Mechanical Technical Inspection, the Driver Template must meet the clearance
specified in F.5.6.3

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
COCKPIT TEMPLATE INSPECTIONS
The Cockpit Template Inspections will be conducted as part of the Mechanical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.7.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Cockpit Opening will be checked using the template and procedure given in T.1.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.7.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Internal Cross Section will be checked using the template and procedure given in T.1.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cockpit Template Criteria
To pass Mechanical Technical Inspection, both Cockpit Templates must fit as described.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inspection Items
The following items must be brought to Mechanical Technical Inspection:
• Vehicle on Dry Tires V.4.3.1
• Technical Inspection Form
• Push Bar VE.2.2
• Structural Equivalency Spreadsheet (SES) – electronic copy F.2.1
• Monocoque Laminate Test Specimens (if applicable) F.4.3
• The Impact Attenuator that was tested (if applicable) F.8.8.7
• Accumulator Container samples (EV only) (if applicable) F.10.2.1.c, F.10.2.2.c
• Electronic copies of any submitted Rules Questions with the received answer GR.7

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Aerodynamic Devices Stability and Strength

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any Aerodynamic Devices may be checked by pushing on the device in any direction and at
any point.
The following is guidance, but actual conformance will be up to technical inspectors at the
respective competitions. The intent is to reduce the likelihood of wings detaching

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If any deflection is significant, then a force of approximately 200 N may be applied.
a. Loaded deflection should not be more than 25 mm
b. Any permanent deflection less than 5 mm

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If any vehicle on track is observed to have large, uncontrolled movements of Aerodynamic
Devices, then officials may Black Flag the vehicle for IN.15 Reinspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Dimensions of the Monocoque will be confirmed F.7.1.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the Front Hoop is integrally bonded or laminated to the monocoque F.7.4.3, provide:
a. Documentation that shows dimensions on the tubes
b. Pictures of the dimensioned tube being included in the layup

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
For items which cannot be verified by an inspector, the team must provide documentation,
visual and/or written, that the requirements have been met.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A team found to be improperly presenting any evidence of the manufacturing process may be
barred from competing with a monocoque.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Engine Inspection (IC Only)
The organizer may measure or tear down engines to confirm conformance to the rules.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.8.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Mechanical Inspection Completion
All vehicles must pass Mechanical Technical Inspection before a vehicle may attempt any
further inspections.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tilt Test Requirements
a. The vehicle must contain the maximum amount of fluids it may carry
b. The tallest driver must be seated in the normal driving position
c. Tilt tests may be conducted in one or the other, or both directions in order to pass
d. (IC only) Engines fitted with mechanically actuated fuel pumps must be run to fill and
pressure the system downstream of the High Pressure pump. See IC.6.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.9.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: No fluid leakage of any type when the vehicle is tilted to a 45° angle to the horizontal

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.9.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Vehicle does not roll when tilted at an angle of 60° to the horizontal, corresponding to 1.7 g.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.9.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Tilt Test Completion
Tilt Tests must be passed before a vehicle may attempt any further inspections

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The sound level will be measured during a stationary test, with the vehicle gearbox in neutral
at the defined Test Speed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Measurements will be made with a free field microphone placed:
• free from obstructions
• at the Exhaust Outlet vertical level IC.7.2.2
• 0.5 m from the end of the Exhaust Outlet IC.7.2.2
• at an angle of 45° with the outlet in the horizontal plane (see IN.10.2.2 below)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Where the Exhaust has more than one Exhaust Outlet:
a. The noise test is repeated for each outlet
b. The highest sound level is used

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Exhaust Outlets that are not parallel to the ground may be tested outside of the horizontal
plane.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the exhaust has any form of active tuning or throttling device or system, the exhaust must
meet all requirements with the device or system in all positions.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the exhaust has a manually adjustable tuning device(s):
a. The position of the device must be visible to the officials for the noise test
b. The device must be manually operable by the officials during the noise test
c. The device must not be moved or modified after the noise test is passed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Industrial Engine
An engine which, according to the manufacturers’ specifications and without the required
restrictor, is capable of producing 5 hp per 100 cc or less.
Submit a Rules Question to request approval of an Industrial Engine.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Maximum Test Speed
The engine speed that corresponds to an average piston speed of:
a. Automotive / Motorcycle engines 914.4 m/min (3,000 ft/min)
b. Industrial Engines 731.5 m/min (2,400 ft/min)
The calculated speed will be rounded to the nearest 500 rpm.
Test Speeds for typical engines are published on the FSAE Online website

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Idle Test Speed
a. Determined by the vehicle’s calibrated idle speed
b. If the idle speed varies then the vehicle will be tested across the range of idle speeds
determined by the team

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must be compliant at all engine speeds up to the maximum defined Test Speed.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Maximum Permitted Sound Level
a. At idle 103 dBC, fast weighting
b. At all other speeds 110 dBC, fast weighting

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Noise levels may be monitored at any time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Noise Test may be repeated at any time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Switch Function
The function of one or more of the Primary Master Switch IC.9.3, Cockpit Main Switch IC.9.4,
and/or BOTS T.3.3 will be verified during the Noise Test

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.10.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Noise Test Completion
Noise Tests must be passed before a vehicle may attempt any further inspections

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.11.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Rain Test Requirements
• Tractive System must be Active
• The vehicle must not be in Ready to Drive mode (EV.7)
• Any driven wheels must not touch the ground
• A driver must not be seated in the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.11.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Rain Test Conduct
The water spray will be rain like, not a direct high pressure water jet
a. Spray water at the vehicle from any possible direction for 120 seconds
b. Stop the water spray
c. Observe the vehicle for 120 seconds

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.11.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Rain Test Completion
The test is passed if the Insulation Monitoring Device (EV.7.6) does not react during the entire
240 seconds duration

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.12.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Objective
The brake system will be dynamically tested and must demonstrate the capability of locking all
four wheels when stopping the vehicle in a straight line at the end of an acceleration run
specified by the brake inspectors

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.12.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Brake Test procedure:
a. Accelerate to speed (typically getting into 2nd gear) until reaching the designated area
b. Apply the brakes with force sufficient to demonstrate full lockup of all four wheels

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.12.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Brake Test passes if:
