• All four wheels lock up
• The engine stays running during the complete test

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.12.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Brake Test procedure:
a. Accelerate to speed until reaching the designated area
b. Switch off the Tractive System
c. Apply the brakes with force sufficient to demonstrate full lockup of all four wheels

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.12.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Brake Test passes if all four wheels lock while the Tractive System is shut down

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.12.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Tractive System Active Light may switch a short time after the vehicle has come to a
complete stop as the reduction of the system voltage is not immediate. See EV.7.2.2.c

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When all parts of Technical Inspection are complete as shown on the Technical Inspection
sheet, the vehicle receives Inspection Approval

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The completed Inspection Sticker denotes the Inspection Approval

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Inspection Approval is contingent on the vehicle remaining in the required condition
throughout the competition.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Organizer, Chief Technical Inspector, or a designee may void Inspection Approval at any
time for any reason

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Inspection Sticker(s) are issued following the completion of all or part of Technical Inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Inspection Sticker(s) must show in the location given in VE.1.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inspection Stickers may be removed from vehicles that are not in compliance with the Rules or
are required to be Reinspected.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.13.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Inspection Approval is valid only for the duration of the specific Formula SAE competition
during which the inspection is conducted.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.14.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Prior to Inspection Approval
Once the vehicle has been presented for judging in the Cost or Design Events, or submitted for
Technical Inspection, and until the vehicle has the full Inspection Approval, the only
modifications permitted to the vehicle are those directed by the Inspector(s) and noted on the
Inspection Form.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.14.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must maintain all required specifications (including but not limited to ride height,
suspension travel, braking capacity (pad material/composition), sound level and wing location)
throughout the competition.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.14.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Changes to fit the vehicle to different drivers are allowed. Permitted changes are:
• Adjustment of the driver restraint system, Head Restraint, seat and pedal assembly
• Substitution of the Head Restraint or seat insert
• Adjustment of mirrors

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.14.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Once the vehicle receives Inspection Approval, the ONLY modifications permitted to the
vehicle are the following:
• Adjustment of belts, chains and clutches
• Adjustment of brake bias
• Adjustment to engine / powertrain operating parameters, including fuel mixture and
ignition timing, and any software calibration changes
• Adjustment of the suspension
• Changing springs, sway bars and shims in the suspension
• Adjustment of Tire Pressure, subject to V.4.3.4
• Adjustment of wing or wing element(s) angle, but not the location T.7.1
• Replenishment of fluids
• Replacement of worn tires or brake pads. Replacement tires and brake pads must be
identical in material/composition/size to those presented and approved at Technical
Inspection.
• Changing of wheels and tires for weather conditions D.6
• Recharging Low Voltage batteries
• Recharging High Voltage Accumulators

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.14.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Repairs or Changes After Inspection Approval
The Inspection Approval may be voided for any reason including, but not limited to:
a. Damage to the vehicle IN.13.1.3
b. Changes beyond those allowed per IN.14.2 above

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.15.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Any vehicle may be Reinspected at any time for any reason

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.15.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Reinspection must be completed to restore Inspection Approval, if voided

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.15.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Technical Inspection process may be repeated in entirety or in part

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.15.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Specific areas or items to be inspected are at the discretion of the Chief Technical Inspector

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.15.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
With Voided Inspection Approval
Successful completion of Reinspection will restore Inspection Approval IN.13.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule IN.15.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
During Dynamic Events
a. Issues found during Reinspection will void Inspection Approval
b. Penalties may be applied to the Dynamic Events the vehicle has competed in
Applied penalties may include additional time added to event(s), loss of one or more
fastest runs, up to DQ, subject to official discretion.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
GENERAL STATIC
Presentation 75 points
Cost 100 points
Design 150 points
Total 325 points

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Presentation Event Objective
The Presentation Event evaluates the team’s ability to develop and deliver a comprehensive
business, logistical, production, or technical case that will convince outside interests to invest
in the team’s concept.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The concept for the Presentation Event will be provided on the FSAE Online website.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

meeting, virtually, or in conjunction with other Static Events.

ground_truth:

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Submissions may be graded as part of the Presentation Event score.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Pre event submissions will be subject to penalties imposed as given in section DR - Document
Requirements.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

All team members who will give any part of the presentation, or who will respond to judges’

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

Presentations will be time limited. The judges will stop any presentation exceeding the time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.5.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

Teams planning to use data projectors, visual display devices (tablets, computers, etc.), or

own equipment.

response to the judges’ questions.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.

The actual quality of the prototype itself will not be considered as part of the presentation
judging

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Presentation Judging Score Sheet – available at the FSAE Online website.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Judging Sequence
Presentation judging may be conducted in one or more phases.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Presentation raw score is based on the average of the scores of each judge.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Presentation Event scores may range from 0 to 75 points, using a method at the discretion of
the judges

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.2.9.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Event Objective
The Cost and Manufacturing Event evaluates the ability of the team to consider budget and
incorporate production considerations for production and efficiency.
Making tradeoff decisions between content and cost based on the performance of each part
and assembly and accounting for each part and process to meet a budget is part of Project
Management.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Event Supplement
a. Additional specific information on the Cost and Manufacturing Event, including
explanation and requirements, is provided in the Formula SAE Cost Event Supplement
document.
b. Use the Formula SAE Cost Event Supplement to properly complete the requirements of
the Cost and Manufacturing Event.
c. The Formula SAE Cost Event Supplement is available on the FSAE Online website

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Report
Preparation and submission of a report (the “Cost Report”)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Event Day Discussion
Discussion at the Competition with the Cost Judges around the team’s vehicle.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Scenario
Teams will respond to a challenge related to cost or manufacturing of the vehicle.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Cost Report must:
a. List and cost every part on the vehicle using the standardized Cost Tables.
b. Base the cost on the actual manufacturing technique used on the prototype.
Cast parts on the prototype must be cost as cast, and fabricated parts as fabricated, etc.
c. Include Tooling Cost (welding jigs, molds, patterns and dies) for processes requiring it.
d. Exclude R & D and capital expenditures (plant, machinery, hand tools and power tools).
e. Include supporting documentation to allow officials to verify part costing

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Generate and submit the Cost Report using the FSAE Online website, see DR - Document
Requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The BOM is a list for every vehicle part, showing the relationships between the items.
a. The overall vehicle is broken down into separate Systems
b. Systems are made up of Assemblies
c. Assemblies are made up of Parts
d. Parts consist of Materials, Processes and Fasteners
e. Tooling is associated with each Process that requires production tooling

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Late Submission
Penalties for Late Submission of Cost Report will be imposed as given in section DR -
Document Requirements.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
A supplement to the Cost Report that reflects any changes or corrections made after the
submission of the Cost Report may be submitted.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Cost Addendum must be submitted during Onsite Registration at the Event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Cost Addendum must follow the format as given in section DR - Document Requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.7.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Addenda apply only to the competition at which they are submitted.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.7.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A separate Cost Addendum may be submitted for every competition a vehicle attends.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.7.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Changes to the Cost Report in the Cost Addendum will incur additional cost:
a. Added items will be cost at 125% of the table cost: + (1.25 x Cost)
b. Removed items will be credited 75% of the table cost: - (0.75 x Cost)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: All costs in the Cost Report must come from the standardized Cost Tables.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.8.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If a team wishes to use any Parts, Processes or Materials not included in the tables, an Add
Item Request must be submitted. See S.3.10

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Every part may be classified as Made or Bought.
Refer to the Formula SAE Cost Event Supplement for additional information

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If a team genuinely Makes a part listed on the table as a Bought part, they may alternatively
cost it as a Made part only if a place holder entry is listed in the tables enabling them to do so.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.9.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any part which is normally purchased that is optionally shown as a Made part must have
supporting documentation submitted to prove team manufacture.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.9.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Teams costing Bought parts as Made parts will be penalized.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.10.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
An Add Item Request must be submitted on the FSAE Online Website to add items to the Cost
Tables for individual team requirements.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.10.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
After review, the item may be added to the Cost Table with an appropriate cost. It will then
be available to all teams.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.11.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The competition organizers may publish all or part of the submitted Cost Reports.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.11.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Reports for a given competition season will not be published before the end of the
calendar year. Support materials, such as technical drawings, will not be released.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.12.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The following procedure will be used in determining penalties:
a. Penalty A will be calculated using procedure Penalty Method A - Fixed Point Deductions
b. Penalty B will be calculated using procedure Penalty Method B – Adjusted Cost
Additions
c. The higher of the two penalties will be applied against the Cost Event score
• Penalty A expressed in points will be deducted from the Cost Event score
• Penalty B expressed in dollars will be added to the Adjusted Cost of the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.12.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any error that results in a team over reporting a cost in their Cost Report will not be further
penalized.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.12.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Any instance where a team’s score benefits by an intentional or unintentional error on the
part of the students will be corrected on a case by case basis.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.12.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Penalty Method A - Fixed Point Deductions
a. From the Bill of Material, the Cost Judges will determine if all Parts and Processes have
been included in the analysis.
b. In the case of any omission or error a penalty proportional to the BOM level of the error
will be imposed:
• Missing/inaccurate Material, Process, Fastener 1 point
• Missing/inaccurate Part 3 point
• Missing/inaccurate Assembly 5 point
c. Each of the penalties listed above supersedes the previous penalty.
Example - if a point deduction is given for a missing Assembly, the missing Parts are ignored.
d. Differences other than those listed above will be deducted at the discretion of the Cost
Judges.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.12.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Penalty Method B – Adjusted Cost Additions
a. The table cost for the missing or incomplete items will be calculated from the standard
Cost Tables.
b. The penalty will be a value equal to twice the difference between the team cost and the
correct cost for all items in error.
Penalty = 2 x (Table Cost – Team Reported Cost)
The table costs of all items in error are included in the calculation. A missing Assembly would
include the price of all Parts, Materials, Processes and Fasteners making up the Assembly.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.13.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The team must present their vehicle at the designated time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.13.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle must have the tires and wheels declared as Dry Tires per V.4.3.1 installed during
Cost Event judging

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.13.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Teams may be required to bring a copy of the Cost Report and Cost Addendum to Cost Judging

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.13.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Cost Judges will:
a. Review whether the Cost Report accurately reflects the vehicle as presented
b. Review the manufacturing feasibility of the vehicle
c. Assess supporting documentation based on its quality, accuracy and thoroughness
d. Apply penalties for missing or incorrect information in the Cost Report compared to the
vehicle presented at inspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.14.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Teams may be selected for additional review to verify all processes and materials on their
vehicle are in the Cost Report

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.14.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Adjustments from the Cost Audit will be included in the final scores

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.15 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Scenario
The Cost Scenario will be provided prior to the competition on the FSAE Online website
The Cost Scenario will include detailed information about the conduct, scope, and conditions
of the Cost Scenario

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.16.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Cost Event scoring will be provided on the FSAE Online website or with the Cost Scenario

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.16.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Event Scores may be awarded in areas including, but not limited to:
• Price Score
• Discussion Score
• Scenario Score

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.16.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Penalty points may be subtracted from the Cost Score, with no limit.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.3.16.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cost Event scoring may include normalizing the scores of different judging teams and scaling
the results.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Design Event evaluates the engineering effort that went into the vehicle and how the
engineering meets the intent of the market both in terms of vehicle performance and overall
value.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The team and vehicle that illustrate the best use of engineering to meet the design goals, a
cost effective high performance vehicle, and the best understanding of the design by the team
members will win the Design Event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Components and systems that are incorporated into the design as finished items are not
evaluated as a student designed unit, but are assessed on the team’s selection and application
of that unit.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Teams must submit the Design Briefing, Design Spec Sheet and Vehicle Drawings

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
These Design Documents will be used for:
• Design Judge reviews prior to the Design Event
• Sorting teams into appropriate design groups based on the quality of their review.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Penalties for Late Submission of all or any one of the Design Documents will be imposed as
given in section DR - Document Requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Teams that submit one or more Design Documents which do not represent a serious effort to
comply with the requirements may be excluded from the Design Event or be awarded a lower
score.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Design Briefing must use the template from the FSAE Online website.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Refer to the Design Briefing template for:
a. Specific content requirements, areas and details
b. Maximum slides that may be used per topic

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Submit the Design Briefing as given in section DR - Document Requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Vehicle Drawings must meet the following:
a. Three view line drawings showing the vehicle, from the front, top, and side
b. Each drawing must appear on a separate page
c. May be manually or computer generated

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Submit the Vehicle Drawings as given in section DR - Document Requirements

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Design Spec Sheet
Use the format provided and submit the Design Spec Sheet as given in section DR - Document
Requirements
The Design Judges realize that final design refinements and vehicle development may cause
the submitted values to differ from those of the completed vehicle. For specifications that are
subject to tuning, an anticipated range of values may be appropriate.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Inspection Approval IN.13.1.1 is not required prior to Design judging.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicles must be presented for Design judging in finished condition, fully assembled, complete
and ready to run.
a. The judges will not evaluate any vehicle that is presented at the Design event in what
they consider to be an unfinished state.
b. Point penalties may be assessed for vehicles with obvious preparation issues

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Teams may bring to Design Judging any photographs, drawings, plans, charts, example
components or other materials that they believe are needed to support the presentation of
the vehicle and the discussion of their development process.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The available space in the Design Event judging area may be limited.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Judging Sequence
Design judging may be conducted in one or more phases.
Typical Design judging includes a first round review of all teams, then additional review of
selected teams.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Design Judges will:
a. Evaluate the engineering effort based upon the team’s Design Documents, discussion
with the team, and an inspection of the vehicle
b. Inspect the vehicle to determine if the design concepts are adequate and appropriate for
the application (relative to the objectives stated in the rules).
c. Deduct points if the team cannot adequately explain the engineering and construction of
the vehicle

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The Design Judges may assign a portion of the Design Event points to the Design Documents

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.9.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Design Judging Score Sheets are available at the FSAE Online website.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.10.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Scoring may range from 0 to 150 points, at the discretion of the Chief Design Judge

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.10.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Penalty points may be subtracted from the Design score

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule S.4.10.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicles that are excluded from Design judging or refused judging will receive zero points for
Design, and may receive penalty points.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Dynamic Events and Maximum Scores
Acceleration 100 points
Skid Pad 75 points
Autocross 125 points
Efficiency 100 points
Endurance 275 points
Total 675 points

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.1.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Dynamic Area – Any designated portion(s) of the competition site where the vehicles may
move under their own power. This includes competition, inspection and practice areas.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.1.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Staging Area – Any area(s) inside the Dynamic Area prior to the entry to an event for the
purpose of gathering those vehicles that are about to start.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Outside of the Dynamic Area(s), vehicles must be pushed at a normal walking pace using the
Push Bar (VE.2.2), with a driver in the cockpit and with another team member walking beside

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The team may move the vehicle with
a. All four wheels on the ground
b. The rear wheels supported on dollies, by push bar mounted wheels
The external wheels supporting the rear of the vehicle must be non pivoting so the
vehicle travels only where the front wheels are steered. The driver must always be able
to steer and brake the vehicle normally.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: When the Push Bar is attached, the engine must stay off, unless authorized by the officials

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Vehicles must be Shutdown when being moved around the paddock

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicles with wings must have two team members, one walking on each side of the vehicle
when the vehicle is being pushed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.1.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A 25 point penalty may be assessed for each violation

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Fueling and Charging
(IC only) Officials must conduct all fueling activities in the designated location.
(EV only) Accumulator charging must be done in the designated location EV.11.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Powertrain Operation
In the paddock, (IC) Engines may be run or (EV) Tractive System may be Active if all three:
a. The vehicle has passed Technical Inspection up to and including the Tilt Test OR a
Technical Inspector gives permission
b. The vehicle is supported on a stand
c. The drive wheels are minimum 10 cm off the ground, OR the drive wheels are removed

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Drivers Meetings – Attendance Required
All drivers for an event must attend the drivers meeting(s). The driver for an event will be
disqualified if he/she does not attend the driver meeting for the event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Dynamic Area Limitations
Refer to the Event Website for specific information

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The organizer may specify restrictions for the Dynamic Area. These could include limiting the
number of team members and what may be brought into the area.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The organizer may specify additional restrictions for the Staging Area. These could include
limiting the number of team members and what may be brought into the area.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The organizer may establish requirements for persons in the Dynamic Area, such as closed toe
shoes or long pants.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicles must move under their own power only when inside the designated Dynamic Area(s),
unless otherwise directed by the officials.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Driving a vehicle outside of scheduled events or scheduled practice will result in a 200 point
penalty for the first violation and disqualification for a second violation.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Driving Offsite - Prohibited
Teams found to have driven their vehicle at an offsite location during the period of the
competition will be excluded from the competition.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All Driver Equipment and Harness must be worn by the driver anytime in the cockpit with:
a. (IC) Engine running or (EV) Tractive System Active
b. Anytime between starting a Dynamic run and finishing or abandoning that Dynamic run.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Removal of any Driver Equipment during a Dynamic event will result in Disqualification.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Starting
Auxiliary batteries must not be used once a vehicle has moved to the starting line of any
event. See IC.8.1

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A practice area for testing and tuning may be available

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The practice area will be controlled and may only be used during the scheduled times

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.7.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Vehicles using the practice area must have a complete Inspection Sticker

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Instructions from Officials
Obey flags and hand signals from course marshals and officials immediately

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicle Integrity
Officials may revoke the Inspection Approval for any vehicle condition that could compromise
vehicle integrity, compromise the track surface, or pose a potential hazard.
This could result in DNF or DQ of any Dynamic event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.10.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If a vehicle stalls and cannot restart without external assistance, or is damaged and not able to
complete the run, it will be scored DNF for that run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.3.10.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Disabled vehicles will be cleared from the track by the track workers.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
FLAGS
Any specific variations will be addressed at the drivers meeting.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Any Command Flag must be obeyed immediately and without question.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Black Flag - Pull into the Driver Change Area for discussion with the track officials. A time
penalty may be assessed.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Black Flag with Orange Dot - Pull into the Driver Change Area for a mechanical inspection,
something has been observed that needs closer inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Blue Flag - Pull into the designated passing zone to be passed by a faster competitor. Obey the
corner workers signals at the end of the passing zone to merge into competition.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Checkered Flag - Run has been completed. Exit the course at the designated point.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Green Flag – Approval to begin your run, enter the course under direction of the starter. If
you stall the vehicle, please restart and await another Green Flag

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Red Flag - Come to an immediate safe controlled stop on the course. Pull to the side of the
course as much as possible to keep the course open. Follow corner worker directions.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.8 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Yellow Flag (Stationary) - Danger, SLOW DOWN, be prepared to take evasive action,
something has happened beyond the flag station. NO PASSING unless directed by the corner
workers.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.1.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Yellow Flag (Waved) - Great Danger, SLOW DOWN, evasive action is most likely required, BE
PREPARED TO STOP, something has happened beyond the flag station, NO PASSING unless
directed by the corner workers.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: An Information Flag communicates to the driver, but requires no specific action.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Red and Yellow Striped Flag - Something is on the racing surface that should not be there. Be
prepared for evasive maneuvers to avoid the situation.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.4.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
White Flag - There is a slow moving vehicle on the course. Be prepared to approach it at a
cautious rate.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.5.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The organizer may alter the conduct and scoring of the competition based on weather
conditions.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.5.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: No adjustments will be made to times for running in differing Operating Conditions.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.5.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The minimum performance levels to score points may be adjusted by the Officials.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.5.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The following operating conditions will be recognized:
• Dry
• Damp
• Wet

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.5.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The current operating condition will be decided by the Officials and may change at any time.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.5.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The current operating condition will be prominently displayed at the Dynamic Area, and may
be communicated by other means.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.6.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When the operating condition is Damp, teams may change between Dry Tires and Wet Tires:
a. Any time during the Acceleration, Skidpad, and Autocross Events
b. Any time before starting their Endurance Event

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.6.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
All tire changes after a vehicle has received the Green flag to start the Endurance Event must
take place in the Driver Change Area.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.6.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the Operating Condition changes to Wet during Endurance, the track will be Red Flagged or
vehicles will be Black Flagged and brought into the Driver Change Area

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.6.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Time allowed to change tires:
a. Change to Wet Tires - Any time in excess of 10 minutes without driver change, or 13
minutes with Driver Change, will be added to the team's total time for Endurance
b. Change to Dry Tires - The time used to change to Dry Tires will be added to the team’s
total time for Endurance

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.6.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If the vehicle has a tire puncture,
a. The wheel and tire may be replaced with an identical wheel and tire
b. When the puncture is caused by track debris and not a result of component failure or the
vehicle itself, the tire change time will not count towards the team’s total time.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.7.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: An individual team member may not drive in more than three events.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.7.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Efficiency Event is considered a separate event although it is conducted simultaneously
with the Endurance Event.
A minimum of four drivers are required to participate in all of the dynamic events.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.8.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
DOO - Cone is Down or Out when one or both:
a. Cone has been knocked over (Down)
b. The entire base of the cone lies outside the box marked around the cone in its
undisturbed position (Out)

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.8.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
DNF - Did Not Finish – The team attempted a run, but did not complete it, or was not allowed
to complete it

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.8.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: DQ - Disqualified - run(s) or event(s) no longer valid

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.8.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Gate - The path between two cones through which the vehicle must pass. Two cones, one on
each side of the course define a gate. Two sequential cones in a slalom define a gate.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.8.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Entry Gate -The path marked by cones which establishes the required path the vehicle must
take to enter the course.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.8.1.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Exit Gate - The path marked by cones which establishes the required path the vehicle must
take to exit the course.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.8.1.7 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
OC – Off Course
a. The vehicle did not pass through a gate in the required direction.
b. The vehicle has all four wheels outside the course boundary as indicated by cones, edge
marking or the edge of the paved surface.
Where more than one boundary indicator is used on the same course, the narrowest track will
be used when determining Off Course penalties.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
ACCELERATION EVENT
The Acceleration event evaluates the vehicle acceleration in a straight line on flat pavement.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Course length will be 75 m from starting line to finish line

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Course width will be minimum 4.9 m wide as measured between the inner edges of the bases
of the course edge cones

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Cones are placed along the course edges at intervals, approximately 6 m

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Cone locations are not marked on the pavement

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Each team may attempt up to four runs, using two drivers, limited to two runs for each driver

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Runs with the first driver have priority

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each Acceleration run is performed as follows:
a. The foremost part of the vehicle will be staged at 0.30 m behind the starting line
b. A Green Flag or light signal will give the approval to begin the run
c. Timing starts when the vehicle crosses the starting line
d. Timing ends when the vehicle crosses the finish line

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each driver may go to the front of the staging line immediately after their first run to make a
second run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cones (DOO)
Two second penalty for each DOO (including entry and exit gate cones) on that run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Scoring Term Definitions:
• Corrected Time = Acceleration Run Time + ( DOO * 2 )
• Tyour - the best Corrected Time for the team
• Tmin - the lowest Corrected Time recorded for any team
• Tmax - 150% of Tmin

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.9.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: When Tyour > Tmax , Acceleration Score = 4.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
SKIDPAD EVENT
The Skidpad event measures the vehicle cornering ability on a flat surface while making a
constant radius turn.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Course Design
• Two pairs of concentric circles in a figure of eight pattern
• Centers of the circles 18.25 m apart
• Inner circles 15.25 m in diameter
• Outer circles 21.25 m in diameter
• Driving path the 3.0 m wide path between the inner and outer circles

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cone Placement
a. Sixteen (16) pylons will be placed around the inside of each inner circle and thirteen (13)
pylons will be positioned around the outside of each outer circle in the pattern shown in
the Skidpad layout diagram.
b. Each circle will be marked with a chalk line, inside the inner circle and outside the outer
circle
The Skidpad layout diagram shows the circles for cone placement, not for course marking.
Chalk lines are marked on the opposite side of the cones, outside the driving path
c. Additional pylons will establish the entry and exit gates.
d. A cone may be placed in the middle of the exit gate until the finish lap.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Course Operation
a. Vehicles will enter and exit through gates on a 3.0 m wide path that is tangential to the
circles where they meet.
b. The line between the centers of the circles defines the start/stop line.
c. A lap is defined as traveling around one of the circles from the start/stop line and
returning to the start/stop line.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Each team may attempt up to four runs, using two drivers, limited to two runs for each driver.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Runs with the first driver have priority

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each Skidpad run is performed as follows:
a. A Green Flag or light signal will give the approval to begin the run
b. The vehicle will enter perpendicular to the figure eight and will take one full lap on the
right circle
c. The next lap will be on the right circle and will be timed
d. Immediately following the second lap, the vehicle will enter the left circle for the third
lap
e. The fourth lap will be on the left circle and will be timed
f. Immediately upon finishing the fourth lap, the vehicle will exit the track. The exit is at the
intersection moving in the same direction as entered

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each driver may go to the front of the staging line immediately after their first run to make a
second run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cones (DOO)
A 0.125 second penalty for each DOO (including entry and exit gate cones) on that run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Off Course (OC)
DNF for that run. Vehicles that stall or spin out may continue if they have not gone Off
Course.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Incorrect Laps
Vehicles that run an incorrect number of laps or run the laps in the wrong sequence will be
DNF for that run.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.10.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Scoring Term Definitions
• Corrected Time = ( Right Lap Time + Left Lap Time ) / 2 + ( DOO * 0.125 )
• Tyour - the best Corrected Time for the team
• Tmin - is the lowest Corrected Time recorded for any team
• Tmax - 125% of Tmin

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
AUTOCROSS EVENT
The Autocross event evaluates the vehicle maneuverability and handling qualities on a tight
course

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Autocross course will be designed with the following specifications. Average speeds
should be 40 km/hr to 48 km/hr
a. Straights: No longer than 60 m with hairpins at both ends
b. Straights: No longer than 45 m with wide turns on the ends
c. Constant Turns: 23 m to 45 m diameter
d. Hairpin Turns: 9 m minimum outside diameter (of the turn)
e. Slaloms: Cones in a straight line with 7.62 m to 12.19 m spacing
f. Miscellaneous: Chicanes, multiple turns, decreasing radius turns, etc.
g. Minimum track width: 3.5 m
h. Length of each run should be approximately 0.80 km

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Autocross course specifications may deviate from the above to accommodate event site
requirements.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Each team may attempt up to four runs, using two drivers, limited to two runs for each driver

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Runs with the first driver have priority

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each Autocross run is performed as follows:
a. The vehicle will be staged at a specific distance behind the starting line
b. A Green Flag or light signal will give the approval to begin the run
c. Timing starts when the vehicle crosses the starting line
d. Timing ends when the vehicle crosses the finish line

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each driver may go to the front of the staging line immediately after their first run to make a
second run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cones (DOO)
Two second penalty for each DOO (including cones after the finish line) on that run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Off Course (OC)
a. When an OC occurs, the driver must reenter the track at or prior to the point of exit or
receive a 20 second penalty
b. Penalties will not be assessed for accident avoidance or other reasons deemed sufficient
by the track officials.
