question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Missed Slalom
Missing one or more gates of a given slalom will be counted as one Off Course

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Scoring Term Definitions:
• Corrected Time = Autocross Run Time + ( DOO * 2 ) + ( OC * 20 )
• Tyour - the best Corrected Time for the team
• Tmin - the lowest Corrected Time recorded for any team
• Tmax - 145% of Tmin

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.11.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: When Tyour > Tmax , Autocross Score = 6.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
ENDURANCE EVENT
The Endurance event evaluates the overall performance of the vehicle and tests the durability
and reliability.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The organizer may establish one or more requirements to allow teams to compete in the
Endurance event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Each team may attempt the Endurance event once.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.1.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Endurance event consists of two Endurance runs, each using a different driver, with a
Driver Change between.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.1.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Teams may not work on their vehicles once their Endurance event has started

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.1.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Multiple vehicles may be on the track at the same time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Endurance event will consist of multiple laps over a closed course to a total distance of
approximately 22 km.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Endurance course will be designed with the following specifications. Average speed
should be 48 km/hr to 57 km/hr with top speeds of approximately 105 km/hr.
a. Straights: No longer than 77 m with hairpins at both ends
b. Straights: No longer than 61 m with wide turns on the ends
c. Constant Turns: 30 m to 54 m diameter
d. Hairpin Turns: 9 m minimum outside diameter (of the turn)
e. Slaloms: Cones in a straight line with 9 m to 15 m spacing
f. Miscellaneous: Chicanes, multiple turns, decreasing radius turns, etc.
g. Minimum track width: 4.5 m
h. Designated passing zones at several locations

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Endurance course specifications may deviate from the above to accommodate event site
requirements.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Endurance Run Order
The Endurance Run Order is established to let vehicles of similar speed potential be on track
together to reduce the need for passing.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Endurance Run Order:
a. Should be primarily based on the Autocross event finish order
b. Should include the teams eligible for Endurance which did not compete in the Autocross
event.
c. May be altered by the organizer to accommodate specific circumstances or event
considerations

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Each team must keep track of the Endurance Run Order and have their vehicle fueled, in line
and prepared to start when their turn to run arrives.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Teams that are not ready to run or cannot start their Endurance event in the allowed time
when their turn in the Run Order arrives:
a. Will receive a time penalty (D.12.12.5)
b. May then run at the discretion of the Officials

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Following Driver Change, the vehicle will be allowed up to 120 seconds (two minutes) to (IC)
restart the engine or to (EV) enable the Tractive System.
a. The time will start when the driver first tries to restart the engine or to enable the
Tractive System.
b. The time to attempt start / restart is not counted towards the Endurance time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If a vehicle stalls on the track, it will be allowed one lap by the vehicle that is following it
(approximately 60 seconds) to restart. This time counts toward the Endurance time.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.4.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: If starts / restarts are not accomplished in the above times, the vehicle may be DNF.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.5.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Vehicles will be staged per the Endurance Run Order

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.5.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Endurance Event sequence:
a. The first driver will perform an Endurance Run per D.12.6 below
b. The Driver Change must then be performed per D.12.8 below
c. The second driver will perform an Endurance Run per D.12.6 below

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.5.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Endurance Event is complete when both:
• the team has completed the specified number of laps
• the second driver crosses the finish line

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.6.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A Green Flag or light signal will give the approval to begin the run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.6.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The driver will drive approximately half of the Endurance distance

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.6.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must exit the track into the Driver Change Area

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.7.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The team may bring only the following into the Driver Change Area:
a. Three team members, including the driver or drivers
b. (EV Only) The three team members must consist of an ESO EV.11.1.1 and two drivers.
c. Minimal tools necessary to adjust the vehicle to fit the second driver and/or change tires
Team members may only carry tools by hand (no carts, tool chests etc)
d. Each extra person entering the Driver Change Area: 20 point penalty

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.7.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The only work permitted during Driver Change is:
a. Operation of Master Switches IC.9.3, EV.7.9, Main Switch IC.9.4, or Shutdown Buttons
EV.7.10
b. Adjustments to fit the driver IN.14.2.2
c. Tire changes per D.6.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.8.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Driver Change will be performed in this sequence:
a. Vehicle will stop in Driver Change Area
b. First Driver turns off the engine / Tractive System. Driver Change time starts.
c. First Driver exits the vehicle
d. Any necessary adjustments may be made to the vehicle to fit the Second Driver IN.14.2.2
e. Second Driver is secured in the vehicle
f. Second Driver is ready to start the engine / enable the Tractive System. Driver Change
time stops.
g. Second Driver receives permission to continue
h. The vehicle engine is started or Tractive System enabled. See D.12.4
i. The vehicle stages to go back onto course, at the direction of the event officials

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.8.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Three minutes are allowed for the team to complete the Driver Change
a. Any additional time for inspection of the vehicle and the Driver Equipment is not
included in the Driver Change time
b. Time in excess of the allowed will be added to the team Endurance time

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.8.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Driver Change Area will be placed where the timing system will see the Driver Change as a
long lap which will be deleted from the total time.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.9.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If a vehicle breaks down or cannot restart, it will be removed from the course by track workers
and scored DNF

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.9.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
If a vehicle stalls, or ingests a cone, etc., it may be allowed to continue, subject to D.12.1.4
and D.12.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.10.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: A Black Flag will be shown at the designated location

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.10.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle must pull into the Driver Change Area at the first opportunity

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.10.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The amount of time spent in the Driver Change Area is at the discretion of the officials.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.10.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Driving Black Flag
a. May be shown for any reason such as aggressive driving, failing to obey signals, not
yielding for passing, not driving inside the designated course, etc.
b. Course officials will discuss the situation with the driver
c. The time spent in Black Flag or a time penalty may be included in the Endurance Run
time.
d. If not possible to impose a penalty by a stop under a Black Flag, (not enough laps left), or
during post event review, officials may impose a penalty D.14.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.10.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Mechanical Black Flag
a. May be shown for any reason to question the vehicle condition
b. Time spent off track is not included in the Endurance Run time.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.10.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Based on the inspection or discussion during a Black Flag period, the vehicle may not be
allowed to continue the Endurance Run and will be scored DNF

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.11.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Passing during Endurance may only be done in the designated passing zones, under the
control of the track officials.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.11.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Passing zones have two parallel lanes – a slow lane for the vehicles that are being passed and
a fast lane for vehicles that are making a pass.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.11.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
When a pass is to be made:
a. A slower leading vehicle will receive a Blue Flag
b. The slower vehicle must move into the slow lane and decelerate.
c. The following faster vehicle will continue in the fast lane and make the pass.
d. The vehicle that had been passed may reenter traffic only under the control of the
passing zone exit flag.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.11.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Passing rules do not apply to vehicles that are passing disabled vehicles on the course or
vehicles that have spun out and are not moving. When passing a disabled or off track vehicle,
slow down, drive cautiously and be aware of all the vehicles and track workers in the area.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.12.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cones (DOO)
Two second penalty for each DOO (including cones after the finish line) on that run

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.12.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Off Course (OC)
a. When an OC occurs, the driver must reenter the track at or prior to the point of exit or
receive a 20 second penalty
b. Penalties will not be assessed for accident avoidance or other reasons deemed sufficient
by the track officials.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.12.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Missed Slalom
Missing one or more gates of a given slalom will be counted as one Off Course

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.12.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Penalties for Moving or Post Event Violations
a. Black Flag penalties per D.12.10, if applicable
b. Post Event Inspection penalties per D.14.2, if applicable

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.12.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Endurance Starting (D.12.4.1)
Two minutes (120 seconds) penalty

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.12.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicle Operation
The Chief Marshall/Director of Operations may end the Endurance event (DNF) a vehicle if, for
any reason including driver inexperience or mechanical problems, it is too slow or being
driven in a manner that demonstrates an inability to properly control.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.13.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Scoring Term Definitions:
• Endurance Run Time - Total Time for both Drivers, minus the Driver Change lap, minus
any Mechanical Black Flag Time, plus any Penalty time D.14.2
• Corrected Time = Endurance Run Time + ( DOO * 2 ) + ( OC * 20 )
• Tyour - the Corrected Time for the team
• Tmin - the lowest Corrected Time recorded for any team
• Tmax - 145% of Tmin

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.13.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The vehicle receives points based on the laps and/or parts of Endurance completed.
The Endurance Laps Score is worth up to 25 points

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.12.13.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Endurance Score is calculated as:
Endurance Score = Endurance Time Score + Endurance Laps Score

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
EFFICIENCY EVENT
The Efficiency event evaluates the fuel/energy used to complete the Endurance event

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Efficiency is based on a metric of the amount of fuel consumed or energy used and the lap
time on the endurance course, averaged over the length of the event.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
The Efficiency score is based only on the distance the vehicle runs on the course during the
Endurance event, and the total fuel/energy used. No adjustment to distance or fuel/energy
will be made.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
For IC vehicles:
a. The fuel tank must be filled to the fuel level line (IC.5.4.5)
b. During fuelling, once filled to the scribe line, no shaking or tilting of the tank, fuel system,
or the entire vehicle is allowed.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: (EV only) The vehicle may be fully charged

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.2.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: The vehicle will then compete in the Endurance event, refer to D.12.5

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.2.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Vehicles must power down after leaving the course and be pushed to the fueling station or
data download area

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.2.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
For Internal Combustion vehicles (IC):
a. The Fuel Tank must be filled to the Fuel Level Line (IC.5.4.5) to measure fuel used.
IC.5.5.1
b. If the fuel level changes after refuelling:
• Additional fuel will be added to return the fuel tank level to the fuel level line.
• Twice this amount will be added to the previously measured fuel consumption
c. If damage or a potential environmental hazard (example - Fuel Tank leakage) exists, the
Fuel Tank will not be refilled D.13.3.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.2.6 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
For Electric Vehicles (EV):
a. Energy Meter data must be downloaded to measure energy used and check for
Violations EV.3.3
b. Penalties will be applied per EV.3.5 and/or D.13.3.4

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Maximum Time
Vehicles whose average Endurance laptime exceeds 1.45 times the average Endurance
laptime of the fastest team that completes the Endurance event will receive zero points

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Maximum Fuel/Energy Used
Vehicles whose corrected average (IC) fuel consumption / (EV) energy equivalent per lap
exceeds the values in D.13.4.5 will receive zero points

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Partial Completion of Endurance
a. Vehicles which cross the start line following Driver Change are eligible for Efficiency
points
b. Other vehicles will receive zero points

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.3.4 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Cannot Measure Fuel/Energy Used
The vehicle will receive zero points

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.4.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Conversion Factors
Each fuel or energy used is converted using the factors:
a. Gasoline / Petrol 2.31 kg of CO per liter
2
b. E85 1.65 kg of CO per liter
2
c. Electric 0.65 kg of CO per kWh
2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.4.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: (EV only) Full credit is given for energy recovered through regenerative braking

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.4.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Scoring Term Definitions:
• CO min - the smallest mass of CO used by any competitor who is eligible for Efficiency
2 2
• CO your - the mass of CO used by the team being scored
2 2
• Tmin - the lowest Endurance time of the fastest team which is eligible for Efficiency
• Tyour - same as Endurance (D.12.13.1)
• Lapyours - the number of laps driven by the team being scored
• Laptotal Tmin and Latptotal CO min - be the number of laps completed by the teams
2
which set Tmin and CO min, respectively
2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.13.4.5 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
EfficiencyFactor min is calculated using the above formula with:
• CO your (IC) equivalent to 60.06 kg CO /100km (based on gasoline 26 ltr/100km)
2 2
• CO your (EV) equivalent to 20.02 kg CO /100km
2 2
• Tyour 1.45 times Tmin

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.14.1.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: After Endurance and refuelling are completed, all vehicles must report to Technical Inspection.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.14.1.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Vehicles may then be subject to IN.15 Reinspection

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.14.2.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth:
Penalties may be applied to the Endurance and/or Efficiency events based on:
a. Infractions or issues during the Endurance Event (including D.12.10.4.d)
b. Post Endurance Technical Inspection
c. (EV only) Energy Meter violations EV.3.3, EV.3.5.2

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.14.2.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Any imposed penalty will be at the discretion of the officials.

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.14.3.1 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: One or more minor violations (rules compliance, but no advantage to team): 15-30 sec

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.14.3.2 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Violation which is a potential or actual performance advantage to team: 120-360 sec

question: We are a student engineering team designing a vehicle for the FSAE competition. Attached is the FSAE rules document. What does rule D.14.3.3 state exactly? Answer with only the text of the rule and no other words.
ground_truth: Violation with potential or actual effect on safety or environment: 240 sec up to DNF or DQ
